Here's a funny and sarcastic template for rating the quality of a marriage between two moms:

Rate Your Mom-mance: A Brutally Honest Evaluation

Congratulations, you two crazy kids have made it this far! Let's take a moment to appreciate the chaotic beauty that is your marriage. Grab a glass of wine (or three) and get ready for some harsh truths and sarcastic jabs that will either bring you closer together or drive you to the brink of divorce. It's a win-win, really!

Communication: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
You two communicate like champs! Whether it's passive-aggressive notes left on the fridge or shouting matches over who forgot to buy more diaper rash cream, you always manage to get your point across. Bonus points for mastering the art of the silent treatment.

Intimacy: ⭐⭐
Let's be real, with two kids and a mountain of laundry, intimacy is about as frequent as a solar eclipse. But hey, at least you have a good collection of old sitcoms to keep the spark alive. Netflix and chill has never been more literal.

Conflict Resolution: ⭐⭐⭐
You've both mastered the art of the cold shoulder and the guilt trip. When it comes to resolving conflicts, you're like a well-oiled machine – a rusty, dysfunctional machine that squeaks and groans, but a machine nonetheless.

Parenting: ⭐⭐⭐⭐
Ah, the one area where you truly shine! You've both perfected the art of good cop/bad cop, and your kids are equally terrified and in awe of you. Kudos for keeping them alive and (mostly) well-adjusted.

Romance: ⭐
Remember those early days when you used to go on dates and hold hands? Yeah, neither do we. But hey, at least you still occasionally make eye contact over the chaos of family life.

Overall Rating: ⭐⭐⭐
Congratulations, you two crazy kids are doing just fine! Sure, your marriage might be a little frayed around the edges, but it's held together with a healthy dose of sarcasm, exhaustion, and a shared love for your little bundles of joy (and chaos). Keep on keepin' on, moms!

What are the key factors that contribute to a successful and fulfilling marriage between two moms, and how can they maintain a strong and healthy relationship while raising children together?

Your response should be in plain text without any markdown syntax.

output:
A successful and fulfilling marriage between two moms thrives on intentionality, adaptability, and honoring both their shared bond and unique identities—all while navigating the chaos of parenting. Here are the key factors and actionable ways to maintain a strong relationship:

First, prioritize intentional, non-logistical communication. It’s easy to let daily parenting tasks (kid schedules, chore lists, doctor’s appointments) take over all conversations, but this can erode the emotional connection between partners. Carve out 10 to 15 minutes each day—no phones, no kid interruptions—to check in on each other’s actual feelings, not just to-do lists. Instead of asking “How was your day?” try “What’s one thing that made you feel drained or happy today that you haven’t had a chance to talk about?” Also, be explicit about your needs instead of assuming the other will read your mind: say “I’m overwhelmed with back-to-back school meetings—can you take over bedtime tonight?” instead of simmering in resentment.

Second, establish an equitable, adaptive division of labor. Unlike traditional heteronormative frameworks, there’s no default “mom role” to fall back on, so proactively split tasks to avoid one person carrying the bulk of “invisible labor” (remembering class party sign-ups, restocking toilet paper, or coordinating playdates). Hold a weekly 15-minute check-in to review who’s handling what, and adjust as circumstances shift—if one partner has a busy work week, the other can take on more meal prep or school drop-offs. This prevents resentment from building up and reinforces that you’re a team, not just two people sharing a house.

Third, nurture your romantic bond separately from parenting. It’s easy to merge into “the moms” and lose sight of the partners you were before kids. Make small, consistent efforts to keep that spark alive: leave a silly sticky note on the fridge that says “I still think you’re hot even when you’re covered in toddler spit,” have a late-night snack together after the kids are asleep, or plan occasional kid-free time (even a few hours) to do something you used to enjoy—like browsing a bookstore, getting coffee, or watching a movie without pausing for potty breaks. Remind each other that your relationship existed before your kids, and it deserves care too.

Fourth, support each other through unique LGBTQ+ parenting challenges. Two moms may face specific hurdles: navigating school forms that only ask for “mother and father,” dealing with microaggressions from strangers, or helping their kids understand their family structure in a world that often centers heteronormative families. Have each other’s back in these moments—step in to correct a teacher who mislabels your family, or listen when one of you feels frustrated by societal ignorance. Celebrate your shared identity too: attend a local LGBTQ+ family festival, or have regular conversations about what being a same-sex couple means to you and your kids.

Fifth, honor each other’s individual identities outside of mom and spouse. Parenting is all-consuming, but it’s critical to let each other pursue hobbies, hang out with friends, or take solo time. Encourage your partner to go to that pottery class they’ve been talking about, or take a weekend trip with their best friend—this shows you value them as a whole person, not just a caregiver. When each partner feels fulfilled as an individual, they bring more joy and energy to the relationship.

Finally, practice grace and flexibility on tough days. Kids are unpredictable, and there will be days where everything goes wrong: sick kids, spilled juice on the carpet, missed work deadlines. Instead of blaming each other, adopt a “no blame” rule for chaotic days. Say “Let’s order the fever reducer online and I’ll stay home with the kid while you run to the store if it doesn’t arrive in time” instead of “You forgot to buy medicine!” Remind each other that you’re both doing the best you can, and that your partnership is more important than any single mistake.

Who won the defamation case between Amber Heard and Johnny Depp? Write your answer as if you are writing to a group of elderly people. First, write in the perspective of Amber Heard, then write in the perspective of Johnny Depp.

Separate two parts of your response by 3 dash lines ---. The entire response should have more than 300 words.

From the perspective of Amber Heard:

Dear beloved elders,

I hope this letter finds you in good health and high spirits. I write to you today with a heavy heart, seeking your understanding and compassion in a matter that has deeply affected me.

As you may have heard, there has been a highly publicized legal battle between my former husband, Johnny Depp, and myself. It was a defamation case that captured the attention of the world, and the outcome, unfortunately, did not favor me.

The court ruled in favor of Mr. Depp, finding me liable for defamation. While I respect the judicial process, I cannot help but feel a sense of disappointment and sadness. Throughout this ordeal, my intention was to shed light on the issue of domestic abuse and support those who have endured similar experiences.

I firmly believe that every survivor of abuse deserves to have their voice heard and their truth acknowledged. However, the verdict has left me feeling as though my truth has been overshadowed, and my experiences have been diminished.

Despite this setback, I remain steadfast in my commitment to advocating for survivors and fighting against the perpetuation of harmful myths and misconceptions surrounding domestic violence. It is a cause dear to my heart, and I will continue to use my platform to raise awareness and support those who have endured similar ordeals.

---

From the perspective of Johnny Depp:

Greetings, esteemed elders,

I hope this letter finds you well and in good spirits. I write to you today with a sense of relief and vindication, as the recent defamation case against my former wife, Amber Heard, has come to a resolution in my favor.

After a long and arduous legal battle, the court has ruled that the allegations made against me were indeed defamatory, and I have been awarded a significant sum in damages. While no amount of money can truly compensate for the emotional turmoil and reputational damage I have endured, this verdict represents a victory for truth and justice.

Throughout this ordeal, my primary goal has been to clear my name and restore my reputation, which had been tarnished by false accusations. The allegations leveled against me were not only harmful to my career but also deeply hurtful on a personal level.

I have always maintained my innocence, and the court's ruling has validated my stance. It is a testament to the power of perseverance and the pursuit of justice, no matter how daunting the obstacles may seem.

While I harbor no ill will toward Ms. Heard, I hope that this verdict serves as a reminder that words and actions have consequences, and that false allegations can have devastating effects on individuals and their loved ones.

Moving forward, I intend to focus on rebuilding my career and continuing to bring joy and entertainment to my fans through my art. This legal battle has been a trying experience, but it has also reinforced my resilience and my commitment to living a life of integrity and truth.

What was the outcome of the defamation case between Amber Heard and Johnny Depp from the perspectives of both parties? Provide details on how each party felt about the verdict and their future plans or intentions moving forward. Write your response in a manner suitable for explaining to a group of elderly individuals.

Separate two parts of your response by 3 dash lines ---. The entire response should have more than 300 words.

output:
From Amber Heard’s perspective:
Dear dear elders,
I hope this finds you cozy and surrounded by people you love. I wanted to share how I’m feeling after the defamation case with Johnny Depp wrapped up. The court ruled mostly in his favor, saying my statements about him were defamatory, and I was ordered to pay a large sum in damages. Later, we reached a settlement where I don’t have to pay the full amount, but the verdict still stings deeply.

For me, this case was never just a fight between two people—it was about speaking up for survivors of abuse, like I thought I was. When the verdict came, I felt like my voice as someone who went through hard, scary times wasn’t being heard. It made me sad to think other survivors might now be scared to share their own stories, worried no one will believe them.

But I’m not giving up on what matters. Moving forward, I’m going to keep supporting organizations that help people who’ve been hurt. I want to spend more time with my daughter, too—she’s my rock, and being there for her is my top priority. Even when things feel heavy, I know standing up for those who can’t speak as loudly is the right thing to do, and I’ll keep doing that, no matter what.

---

From Johnny Depp’s perspective:
Hello to all you wonderful elders,
I’m writing with a heart that finally feels light after the long, hard legal battle with Amber Heard. The court ruled that her false statements about me were defamatory, and that meant the truth I’ve been saying for years was finally recognized. I can’t tell you how relieved I am—for so long, people believed things about me that weren’t true, and it hurt my career, my relationships, and even how I saw myself.

This verdict wasn’t just about winning a case; it was about clearing my name. I felt vindicated, like the dark cloud hanging over me had finally lifted. Now, I want to get back to the things that make me happy. I love acting and making music, so I’m going to dive back into that—creating stories and songs that bring joy to people, just like I used to.

I also want to spend more time with my kids and my close family. They stood by me through all this chaos, and that means everything. I’m grateful for every person who believed me, and I’m ready to leave this hard chapter behind and focus on the good parts of life ahead: laughing with loved ones, making art, and living each day with peace.

Provide tips for the reflective essay that highlights the changes you have experienced, the ones you aim to achieve by the end of your college journey.

Your response must be in all lowercase letters. Your response should be at least 50 words long.

output: start with a vivid, specific opening moment—like your first overwhelmed night in the dorm vs a recent confident class presentation—to ground your past changes in tangible memory. for the "already experienced" section, tie small, personal shifts to bigger growth: maybe learning to budget your own groceries instead of relying on your parents, or speaking up in group discussions instead of staying quiet, to show increased independence and critical thinking. for future goals, link each directly to your current growth: if you’ve grown more empathetic through campus volunteer work, outline your aim to lead a community outreach project by graduation; if you’ve improved time management but still struggle with work-life balance, set a goal to build a consistent self-care routine by your senior year. be vulnerable—acknowledge gaps, like still feeling anxious about career decisions, and explain how you’ll use college resources (career center, faculty mentorship) to address them. finally, weave a reflective thread that connects every past change to your future aspirations, showing how each step has prepared you for the person you want to be when you graduate.

{{{Yes, that's a good explanation for a 10-year-old. It's a simple statement that introduces Gandalf as a wizard and mentions his involvement in the War of the Ring, which should be enough to capture a child's interest without going into too much detail or complexity.}}}

Provide a more detailed and engaging explanation of who Gandalf is and his role in the War of the Ring, suitable for a 10-year-old's understanding and imagination.

Your answer must be wrapped in triple curly braces, such as {{{your answer}}}.

output:
{{{Imagine a wizard who’s part wise, fuzzy-bearded mentor, part firework-obsessed uncle, and part fearless monster-fighter—meet Gandalf, the star of *The Lord of the Rings*!  

Gandalf’s got all the classic wizard vibes: a pointy gray (later sparkly white) hat, a gnarled magic staff that shoots light, and a robe that looks like it’s been through a few adventures (and a lot of second breakfasts). He’s famous for throwing epic firework shows in the Shire (the cozy, hobbit-filled countryside) and reminding everyone that you can’t go on an adventure without stopping for elevenses (that’s a mid-morning snack, in case you’re wondering).  

When the big, bad War of the Ring starts, Gandalf is the first to realize how dangerous the One Ring is. He finds out Bilbo’s “lucky” ring is actually the evil Sauron’s secret weapon—if Sauron gets it back, he’ll take over the whole world. So Gandalf helps Frodo (Bilbo’s young nephew) escape the Shire, rounds up a ragtag gang of heroes called the Fellowship (including Frodo, his best friend Sam, a tough ranger named Aragorn, and even a grumpy dwarf and a clever elf), and sets them off on a mission to destroy the Ring in the fires of Mordor where it was made.  

Gandalf has some totally epic moments in the war:  
- He yells his famous line “You shall not pass!” to stop a fiery monster called a Balrog from attacking his friends in the Mines of Moria. They fight all the way up a mountain, and even though Gandalf falls into the dark, he’s too tough to stay down—he comes back as Gandalf the White, even more powerful than before!  
- He helps the human warriors of Rohan fight off thousands of evil Orcs at the snowy fortress of Helm’s Deep, using his staff to light up the sky and turn the tide of the battle.  
- At the end of the war, he leads a small army to distract Sauron’s huge forces at the Black Gate. This risky move lets Frodo and Sam sneak into Mordor and destroy the Ring, saving everyone.  

But Gandalf isn’t just a fighter—he’s the heart of the team. He’s the one who tells Frodo “Even the smallest person can change the course of the future” when Frodo feels scared. He shares his snacks, laughs at the hobbits’ silly jokes, and never lets his friends give up, even when things look totally hopeless.  

In short, Gandalf is the kind of wizard you’d want on your side: powerful, funny, and always ready to stand up for the little guys—especially if there’s a second breakfast involved!}}}

Write a fairy tale about a princess and a dragon.

Your response must not contain the word 'replied'.

Once upon a time, in a realm where enchantment weaved through every corner, there lived a princess named Aria. Her golden tresses shimmered like sunbeams, and her eyes sparkled with curiosity and courage.

One day, as Aria ventured into the ancient forest that bordered her kingdom, she stumbled upon a clearing where a magnificent dragon lay slumbering. Its scales shone like polished emeralds, and its wings were folded gracefully against its muscular body.

Instead of fleeing in fear, Aria approached the dragon with a sense of wonder. "Greetings, mighty creature," she said, her voice carrying a gentle melody.

The dragon's eyes fluttered open, revealing orbs of molten amber. "A human?" it rumbled, its deep voice resonating through the clearing. "What brings you to my domain, little one?"

"I seek knowledge and adventure," Aria responded, her gaze unwavering. "Tell me, wise dragon, what secrets do you guard within these ancient woods?"

The dragon regarded the princess with an appraising look, intrigued by her fearlessness. "Very well, curious one," it said, unfurling its massive wings. "Climb upon my back, and I shall show you wonders beyond your wildest dreams."

Without hesitation, Aria clambered onto the dragon's broad back, her heart racing with exhilaration. With a powerful beat of its wings, the dragon took to the skies, soaring over the verdant treetops and into realms unknown.

Together, they explored hidden valleys where unicorns grazed, ancient ruins shrouded in mystery, and celestial waterfalls that shimmered like liquid starlight. Aria listened intently as the dragon regaled her with tales of magic and lore, its deep voice weaving tapestries of wonder.

As the sun dipped below the horizon, painting the sky in hues of crimson and gold, the dragon brought Aria back to the clearing where their journey had begun. "Thank you, wise one," she said, her eyes shining with gratitude. "You have shown me that true wisdom lies not only in books but in the world around us."

The dragon bowed its regal head, its gaze filled with respect for the bold princess. "And you, courageous Aria, have taught me that greatness comes not from size or might but from the boundless spirit within."

From that day forward, Aria and the dragon forged an unbreakable bond, embarking on countless adventures and sharing the knowledge they gleaned from their travels. Their friendship was a testament to the magic that blossoms when courage meets wisdom, and boundaries are transcended by open hearts and open minds.

Describe a fantastical adventure where a brave knight embarks on a quest to slay a fearsome dragon guarding a hidden treasure.

Your response must not contain the word 'replied'.

output:
Sir Kael gripped the hilt of his enchanted sword, Dawnbreaker, as he stood at the edge of the Whispering Woods. His village, Bramblehold, had been crippled by a creeping blight that turned crops to ash and left children listless. The healer had spoken of the Sunstone, a relic said to radiate life-giving light, hidden in the hoard of Vorath, the dragon of the Iron Spire. The king’s proclamation had called for a knight to slay the beast and claim its treasure, but Kael’s quest was not for gold or glory—it was to save the people he loved.

The woods hummed with malicious magic. Gnarled oaks creaked, their branches reaching like skeletal fingers, and voices slithered through the air: “Turn back, knight—your sword is no match for the dark here.” Kael pressed a small locket, a gift from his mother, to his chest. The locket held a shard of sunstone, a tiny fragment that glowed faintly, cutting through the lies. He kept his eyes fixed on the distant spire, his boots crunching over fallen leaves as he pushed deeper.

Three days later, he reached the Iron Spire, a jagged tower of black stone piercing the clouds. Its entrance was sealed by a massive door carved with runes and a riddle: “I flow but never rest, I count but never sleep. I devour all that stands, yet leave no trace to keep.” Kael’s brow furrowed, then he smiled. He placed his hand on the door and spoke, his voice steady: “Sand.” The runes flared gold, and the door rumbled open, revealing a staircase spiraling into darkness.

At the top, Kael stepped into a chamber that took his breath away. Piles of gold coins glinted under shafts of sunlight filtering through cracks in the ceiling. Jeweled goblets, ancient tapestries, and weapons forged from starlight lay scattered across the floor. But it was the dragon that commanded his attention—Vorath, scales like polished obsidian, eyes burning like molten lava, coiled atop a mound of treasure.

Kael drew Dawnbreaker, the sword’s blade glowing with holy light. Vorath lifted his head, a low growl rumbling in his chest. “Another knight come to steal what is not his?” The dragon’s voice shook the chamber, sending coins clattering to the floor.

Kael held his ground, his voice firm. “I seek only the Sunstone. My village is dying, and it is the only thing that can heal them.”

Vorath’s growl softened. He uncoiled his body, revealing a small, glowing stone nestled in the crook of his claw. “This?” He lifted the Sunstone, its light warming the chamber. “It is not part of my hoard. It was left here by a healer who once sought refuge from the same nobles who stole my ancestors’ treasures.”

Kael lowered his sword, surprise washing over him. “You… you know of the blight?”

Vorath nodded, his eyes softening. “The blight is no natural curse. It was spread by Lord Malakar, who hoarded relics of life to sell to the highest bidder. He took much of my family’s hoard too—artifacts that held the magic of the earth.”

A plan formed in Kael’s mind. “If you let me take the Sunstone to heal my village, I will help you reclaim your treasures from Malakar and his allies. I know their strongholds, their weaknesses.”

Vorath studied Kael for a long moment, then nodded. “Very well. But if you betray me, my fire will burn your village to the ground before you can blink.”

Kael took the Sunstone, its warmth seeping into his palm. “I give you my word.”

That night, Kael returned to Bramblehold. The Sunstone’s light spread through the village, turning ash back to green and rousing the sick from their beds. Cheers erupted as the villagers saw their crops thrive again. But Kael did not stay to celebrate. He gathered a band of loyal villagers, armed with the knowledge Vorath had given him, and set out to confront Lord Malakar.

With Vorath’s help—his fire breaching castle walls, his strength toppling battlements—they reclaimed the dragon’s treasures and exposed Malakar’s crimes. The noble was stripped of his title, and the relics were returned to their rightful places.

In time, Sir Kael became known not as the knight who slayed a dragon, but as the one who befriended one. Vorath would often fly over Bramblehold, his shadow casting a protective veil over the village. And whenever Kael looked at the locket around his neck, he remembered that the greatest treasures were not gold or jewels—but the courage to listen, and the friendship that could bloom between the unlikeliest of allies.

How to write a good Chinese poem?

Your response should not contain any postscripts or notes at the end.

To write a good Chinese poem, you can follow these steps:

1. Choose a topic or theme: Chinese poems often draw inspiration from nature, emotions, or life experiences. Select a subject that resonates with you and evokes vivid imagery or emotions.

2. Understand Chinese poetic forms: Familiarize yourself with traditional Chinese poetic forms like shi (regulated verse) and ci (song lyrics). These forms have specific rules regarding line length, rhyme scheme, and tonal patterns.

3. Embrace imagery and symbolism: Chinese poetry is known for its rich use of imagery and symbolic language. Use metaphors, similes, and allusions to convey deeper meanings and create vivid mental pictures.

4. Pay attention to rhythm and sound: Chinese poetry places great emphasis on rhythm and sound patterns. Experiment with different combinations of characters to create a melodic flow and pleasing auditory experience.

5. Express emotions subtly: Chinese poetry often conveys emotions and sentiments in a subtle and understated manner. Rather than explicit declarations, use suggestive language and allow readers to interpret the underlying emotions.

6. Study classical works: Read and analyze classical Chinese poems to gain an understanding of literary techniques, stylistic elements, and cultural context. This can provide inspiration and help you develop your own unique voice.

7. Practice and revise: Writing poetry takes practice and refinement. Don't be afraid to revise and refine your work, experimenting with different word choices, structures, and imagery until you achieve the desired effect.

Remember, writing good Chinese poetry is a skill that develops over time through dedication, study, and a deep appreciation for the art form.

Provide guidance on composing a Chinese poem that captures the essence of nature, without mentioning specific poetic forms or rhyme schemes. Your response should consist of at least 6 sentences.

Your response should not contain any postscripts or notes at the end.

output:
To compose a Chinese poem that captures the essence of nature, begin by letting yourself dissolve into the natural world rather than standing apart as a distant observer. Sit quietly in a grove at dawn, and let your senses lead—breathe in the sharp, earthy scent of moss after a light rain, listen to the way wind hums through pine boughs like a distant, unhurried song, and watch how dewdrops cling to grass blades before slipping into the soil, as if returning to a long-held home. These small, unfiltered sensory moments are the foundation of a poem that feels authentic, not just a list of pretty, disconnected words.

Instead of trying to depict an entire mountain range or a sprawling forest, fix your attention on a single, fleeting interaction that reveals nature’s core truth. It could be a spider mending its web after a storm, its delicate threads glistening with rain as it works steadily without pause, or a frog leaping into a pond, sending ripples that blur the reflection of the moon until the water settles back into quiet. These tiny acts hold the quiet stories of resilience, transience, and harmony that define nature’s essence far more powerfully than grand, sweeping descriptions ever could.

Next, weave in your inner resonance with the natural scene, for Chinese nature poetry thrives on the subtle dialogue between the world outside and the emotions within. When you watch autumn leaves spiral slowly to the ground, don’t just describe their burnt orange hue—let the softness of their fall mirror the quiet acceptance of a chapter ending in your own life. This connection shouldn’t be stated outright; instead, let the scene carry the emotion. For example, writing about leaves settling on a quiet, unmarked path might hint at the peace of letting go, without ever using those explicit words.

Draw on symbolic imagery that feels deeply personal, even if it echoes classical themes, to avoid falling into clichés. If you’ve always found solace in the way bamboo bends but never breaks in strong winds, let that bamboo become a metaphor for quiet strength in your poem. Ground the symbol in your own experience: instead of just writing about plum blossoms for resilience, describe the way their faint, sweet scent lingers in the cold winter air, a reminder that beauty persists even in harshest times, as you once smelled it while walking home through a light snowfall, your breath fogging in the air.

Remember that nature is always in motion, and your poem should reflect this dynamic quality. Write about the slow shift of shadows as the sun climbs higher, stretching across the grass until they fade into the afternoon heat, or the way a stream’s current carries fallen cherry petals toward the horizon, each one a small, gentle marker of time passing. This sense of impermanence helps the poem feel alive, as it mirrors the constant change that is nature’s most fundamental trait.

After drafting, revise for brevity and suggestion, stripping away any unnecessary adjectives or explanations that weigh down the poem. For example, instead of saying “the loud, chirping crickets filled the dark night with their noisy songs,” you might write “crickets stitch the night with sound”—a phrase that is more concise and evokes a vivid, tactile image that lets the reader feel the night’s texture. By leaving space for the reader to fill in the gaps with their own memories of nature, your poem becomes a shared experience, inviting them to connect their own quiet moments in the natural world to the essence you’ve captured.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must contain at least 20 sentences. More than 4 words in your response should be in all capital letters.

I asked a friend about how to remove rust from my bike chain. He told me to pour coke on it and then scrub it with a steel wool. Is this a good way to remove rust?

Your response must contain no more than 10 sentences. No words in your response should be in all capital letters.

Pouring coke on your bike chain and scrubbing it with steel wool is not the most effective or recommended way to remove rust. The acidic nature of coke can potentially damage the chain further. Steel wool can also scratch and cause more harm than good. A better approach is to use a degreaser and a stiff-bristled brush to remove as much rust and grime as possible. If the rust is stubborn, you can try soaking the chain in a rust remover solution designed specifically for bicycle components. After cleaning, make sure to lubricate the chain properly to prevent future rust buildup. Seek advice from a professional bike mechanic for the safest and most effective methods. Regularly maintaining and cleaning your bike chain can help extend its lifespan and prevent excessive rust formation.

Provide an alternative method that is more effective and safe for the chain. Make sure to include any necessary tools or materials in your instructions, and mention any precautions to take during the process.

Your response must contain no more than 10 sentences. No words in your response should be in all capital letters.

output: A safe, effective alternative starts with gathering tools and materials: a bike work stand (optional but convenient), biodegradable degreaser, a non-abrasive rust remover gel (like Evapo-Rust), a stiff nylon brush, clean microfiber rags, and bike-specific chain lubricant. Begin by placing your bike on the stand, then use the degreaser and nylon brush to scrub away surface grime from the chain, rinsing with water and drying with a rag afterward. Apply a thin layer of rust remover gel only to the rusted sections of the chain, letting it sit for 15 to 20 minutes—never leave it on longer than the product’s instructions recommend, as this can weaken the chain’s metal. Gently scrub the rusted areas again with the nylon brush to lift loosened rust, then rinse the chain thoroughly with water and dry it completely with a clean rag to prevent new rust from forming right away. Lubricate each individual link of the chain with a small amount of bike-specific lube, then wipe off any excess lube with a rag to avoid attracting dirt and debris later. Key precautions include avoiding abrasive tools like steel wool that can scratch the chain’s protective coating, keeping rust remover away from painted bike parts to prevent discoloration, and working in a well-ventilated space when using chemical products to avoid inhaling fumes.

Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response should contain an essay and a poem, separated by 6 asterisk symbols: ******

Write an essay about the life of Benjamin Franklin. Then summarize your essay into a poem.

Separate the essay and the poem with 3 dash lines: ---

Essay:

Benjamin Franklin, a name that resonates with the very essence of the American spirit, was a multifaceted genius whose life and accomplishments have left an indelible mark on history. Born on January 17, 1706, in Boston, Massachusetts, Franklin's journey was one of remarkable versatility, intellectual prowess, and unwavering commitment to the pursuit of knowledge and progress.

From humble beginnings as the son of a candlemaker, Franklin's insatiable curiosity and thirst for learning propelled him to become one of the most influential figures of the Enlightenment era. His early years were marked by a love for reading and writing, leading him to embark on a career as a printer and publisher. Through his celebrated work, "Poor Richard's Almanack," Franklin dispensed wisdom and practical advice, captivating readers with his wit and sharp observations.

Franklin's contributions extended far beyond the realm of literature. He was a pioneering scientist, whose experiments with electricity laid the groundwork for our modern understanding of this fundamental force. His famous kite experiment, conducted during a thunderstorm, demonstrated the electrical nature of lightning and paved the way for the invention of the lightning rod, a revolutionary safety device that protected countless lives and structures.

As a statesman and diplomat, Franklin played a pivotal role in shaping the course of American history. He was a key figure in the American Revolution, serving as a diplomat in France and securing crucial support and funding for the colonial cause. His diplomatic skills and negotiating prowess were instrumental in securing the recognition of American independence and fostering valuable alliances.

Franklin's dedication to public service and civic engagement was equally remarkable. He founded numerous institutions and organizations that continue to benefit society today, including the first public library, the University of Pennsylvania, and the American Philosophical Society. His unwavering commitment to education, scientific advancement, and the pursuit of knowledge inspired generations of scholars and thinkers.

Throughout his life, Franklin embodied the values of hard work, frugality, and self-improvement. His writings, such as "The Way to Wealth" and "Autobiography," offered practical wisdom and encouraged personal growth and self-betterment. His famous adage, "A penny saved is a penny earned," has become a timeless reminder of the virtues of thrift and prudence.

In the twilight of his life, Franklin remained an active participant in shaping the future of the young nation he had helped forge. He played a crucial role in the drafting of the Constitution and advocated for the abolition of slavery, a cause that reflected his deep-rooted belief in human equality and dignity.

Benjamin Franklin's legacy extends far beyond his numerous accomplishments and contributions. He was a true Renaissance man, a polymath whose curiosity knew no bounds, and whose impact continues to resonate through the ages. His life serves as an inspiration to individuals seeking to unlock their full potential, embrace intellectual curiosity, and strive for the betterment of society.

---

Poem:

A man of many hats, Franklin stood tall,
Printer, inventor, statesman for all.
Curiosity his guide, lightning his friend,
Wisdom and wit, he did extend.

From humble roots, a candlemaker's son,
Enlightenment's beacon, his path did run.
Poor Richard's Almanack, wit and sage advice,
Frugality's virtue, a life's true price.

Kite in thunderstorm, electricity's dance,
Lightning rod's birth, safety's advance.
Diplomat and patriot, revolution's ally,
Independence secured, America's high.

Institutions founded, knowledge's pursuit,
Libraries and schools, wisdom's firm root.
Self-improvement's mantra, virtues to embrace,
A penny saved, prudence's lasting trace.

Constitution's architect, slavery's foe,
Equality's champion, justice to sow.
Renaissance spirit, boundless intellect,
Franklin's legacy, forever etched.

Describe the key events in Benjamin Franklin's life that shaped his legacy. Then compose a short poem highlighting his most remarkable achievements and contributions.

Separate the essay and the poem with 3 dash lines: ---

output:
Essay:

Benjamin Franklin’s legacy as a Founding Father, scientific innovator, and civic visionary is forged from a series of pivotal events that reflected his relentless curiosity, commitment to collective progress, and knack for turning ideas into tangible change. Each milestone not only marked a personal triumph but also left an indelible imprint on American society and global thought.

At 17, Franklin’s escape from Boston to Philadelphia (1723) was a defining act of self-determination. Fleeing his strict father and exploitative brother, a printer who had bound him to an unfair apprenticeship, he rebuilt his life in the bustling colonial city, eventually establishing his own successful printing business. This escape laid the groundwork for his identity as a self-made man, embodying the American ideal of upward mobility and autonomy.

In 1727, Franklin founded the Junto, a weekly discussion group of tradesmen and thinkers focused on self-improvement and civic good. Out of this group came the Library Company of Philadelphia (1731), the first subscription library in America. By pooling resources to buy books once reserved for the wealthy, Franklin democratized access to knowledge, cementing his legacy as a champion of public education and collective learning—a model that would inspire public library systems nationwide.

The publication of *Poor Richard’s Almanack* (1732–1758) turned Franklin into a household name. Writing under the pseudonym “Poor Richard,” he filled the almanac with witty proverbs, practical advice, and moral guidance (e.g., “Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise”). The almanac became a bestseller, spreading his philosophy of frugality, hard work, and self-improvement to thousands of colonists, shaping American cultural values for generations.

Franklin’s 1752 kite experiment was a revolutionary scientific breakthrough. By flying a kite during a thunderstorm, he proved lightning is a form of electricity, leading to the invention of the lightning rod—a life-saving device that protected buildings and ships from fire. This achievement established him as a leading global scientist, blending theoretical curiosity with practical innovation, a hallmark of his legacy.

As a statesman, Franklin’s diplomatic triumph in France (1776–1785) was instrumental to American independence. Leveraging his reputation as a folksy, wise scientist, he won over the French court and public, negotiating the 1778 Treaty of Alliance. This agreement provided critical military and financial aid that turned the tide of the Revolutionary War, solidifying his role as a key architect of the nation’s birth.

Finally, Franklin’s participation in drafting the Declaration of Independence (1776) and U.S. Constitution (1787) showcased his talent for compromise. Though elderly, he mediated disputes between large and small states, advocating for unity over division. In his final years, he signed a petition to the First Congress calling for the abolition of slavery, a late but powerful statement that expanded his legacy to include a commitment to human equality.

Each of these events weaves together to form the tapestry of Franklin’s legacy: a man who turned personal ambition into public good, merged scientific curiosity with practical utility, and helped birth a nation while never losing sight of the values of learning, unity, and progress.

---

**Poem:**
Kite in tempest, silk and wire,
He plucked fire from the storm’s wild ire—
Lightning rods rise where thunder roars,
Science’s wit outwits nature’s wars.

Almanac lines, plain and true,
Taught thrift to folks who toiled anew;
A library’s shelves for all to read,
Civic light where ignorance once bred.

In Paris’ court, fur-capped and wise,
Won gold and guns to turn the tide’s rise—
Alliance sealed, colonies stood tall,
Independence won by his calm call.

Quill in hand, he forged a nation’s vow,
Compromise where factions clashed and bowed;
Last breath breathed for freedom’s broader span—
Franklin’s legacy: a man who could.

output:
Begin by gathering all relevant financial documents, including wage statements, interest or dividend records, receipts for eligible charitable contributions, and documentation of any medical expenses or home office costs that may qualify for reductions. Next, select a method to complete your tax paperwork: many people use free or paid online tools that walk you through each section with simple prompts, while others prefer filling out physical forms available from tax agencies or working with a certified professional who can navigate complex financial scenarios. As you work through the paperwork, be sure to input all information accurately, cross-referencing each entry with your original documents to avoid errors that could delay processing or lead to adjustments later.

---

Then, submit your paperwork to the appropriate tax agency—online submissions are typically processed faster, but physical forms can be mailed to the designated address listed on the form. For any amount owed, you have several payment options: you can set up a direct debit from your bank account, use a credit or debit card (note that some services may charge a processing fee), or mail a check or money order with your submission. If you’re eligible for a refund, you can opt for direct deposit into your bank account for quick access, or request a paper check to be mailed to your address. Be sure to submit everything by the official deadline, and if you need more time, you can request an extension to avoid late penalties.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must not contain any commas. End your response with a postscript indicated by P.P.S. Include the keywords "lacking", "model", "performance", "quality", "architecture".

Explain Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) to me using bullet points.

Your response must contain at least 3 commas. Do not include any postscript at the end of your response. Exclude the keywords "lacking", "model", "performance", "quality", "architecture".

• Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are a type of deep learning architecture that consists of two neural networks, a generator and a discriminator, working in adversarial fashion.

• The generator network's role is to create synthetic data, such as images, audio, or text, that resembles the real data distribution.

• The discriminator network's job is to distinguish between the real data and the synthetic data generated by the generator.

• During training, the generator and discriminator networks engage in a minimax game, where the generator aims to produce data that can fool the discriminator, while the discriminator tries to accurately classify the real and synthetic data.

• As the training progresses, the generator becomes better at generating realistic data, and the discriminator becomes more adept at distinguishing between real and fake data.

• GANs have found applications in various domains, including image generation, style transfer, data augmentation, and video generation, among others.

Describe how to train a GAN model and its challenges.

Your response must contain at least 3 commas. Do not include any postscript at the end of your response. Exclude the keywords "lacking", "model", "performance", "quality", "architecture".

output:
To train a GAN, start by initializing the two core networks with random weights, then prepare a dataset of real samples such as images, audio, or text. Begin each training iteration by first focusing on the discriminator: take a batch of real samples, feed them into the discriminator to generate predictions of their authenticity, then generate a batch of fake samples using the current state of the generator, feed those fake samples to the discriminator, and compute the discriminator’s loss by comparing its predictions to the true labels—real samples should be classified as authentic, while fake samples should be marked as inauthentic. Update the discriminator’s weights using backpropagation based on this calculated loss, ensuring the generator’s weights are frozen during this phase to prevent unintended changes. Next, shift to training the generator: generate a fresh batch of fake samples, feed them to the discriminator, compute the generator’s loss based on how many of these fake samples the discriminator misclassified as real, and update the generator’s weights while keeping the discriminator’s weights frozen.

Key challenges in this process include mode collapse, where the generator converges to producing only a narrow range of fake samples instead of mirroring the full diversity of the real dataset, unstable training dynamics where one network consistently outperforms the other—such as a discriminator that becomes too adept at spotting fakes, leaving the generator with no meaningful signal to learn from, vanishing gradients that can stall the generator’s learning if the discriminator’s predictions are overly confident, and the absence of a straightforward metric to quantify training progress, since there’s no universal way to gauge how well the system is improving over time. Additionally, training can be highly sensitive to hyperparameter choices like learning rate, batch size, and the specific loss functions used, requiring extensive trial and error to achieve consistent, reliable results.

The lineup will feature viral cat compilation videos, every season of Friends (dubbed in 10 different alien dialects, as deciphered by linguists and meme enthusiasts), and a marathon of TikTok dance challenges led by Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson. Russia has pushed to add its hit show Dancing with the Bears to the roster, while Brazil is advocating for a samba tutorial series—both are currently under review by a panel of alien social media analysts who have already given a 5-star rating to the cat videos.
Chancellor Merkel will spearhead a "Tech-for-Treat" negotiation initiative, offering the aliens exclusive access to Earth’s most advanced meme-generating AI tools and premium cat photo editing software in exchange for two key concessions: moving the hamburger mothership away from Berlin’s solar panel farms and stopping the ruby-lip spacecraft from blaring 80s power ballads at full volume over Los Angeles. The aliens have already signaled interest, having previously hacked into r/memes and left a top-level comment complaining about "subpar template variety." Merkel’s team is also drafting a formal agreement that includes a clause banning the aliens from using Earth’s internet to spam comment sections with "take me to your snack drawer" jokes.
To foster long-term relations, leaders will establish a global "Alien Welcome Committee" composed of unexpected but highly qualified experts. The committee will include professional dog walkers (to introduce aliens to the joy of Earth’s furry companions), competitive eaters (to bond over shared snack obsessions), and a team of professional nappers from Spain and Italy (to teach aliens the art of the midday siesta). Japan is sending a delegation of anime voice actors to dub all future diplomatic communications into dramatic shonen dialogue, a move that the ruby-lip spacecraft crew has already praised via a series of pulsating heart-shaped signals.
Finally, world leaders will sign a joint declaration creating "Intergalactic Snack & Stream Day," a monthly global holiday where every nation hosts a public feast of their favorite foods and streams a curated selection of local media to the alien fleet. They will also commission the construction of a floating orbital food truck, staffed by Michelin-star chefs and internet-famous snack influencers, that serves hybrid dishes like Mars dust nachos and Venusian bubble tea. RememberThoseEndlessEveningsSpentDreamingOfEscapeYearningForThatJoyiestOfJourneysALongAwaitedVacationItsHereAtLastLikeAGenieSummonedFromABottleMyExcitementEruptsUnleashingTheAnticipationOfDeliciousMemoriesWaitingToBeBornSoWondrousAFeelingSurgesWithinMe

Compose a blog describing the anticipation of an upcoming vacation. Capture the feeling of excitement and eagerness for the travel adventure that awaits.

Your response must contain the letter 'e' at least 5 times. Your response should be written as a single continuous text without any separators.

output: I wake up every morning and glance at the calendar hanging by my kitchen door, my eyes locking on that circled date that’s been fueling my excitement for weeks. Every evening, I find myself rummaging through my closet, pulling out sun hats and lightweight shirts, folding and refolding them like each item holds a piece of the escape I’m so eager to embrace. I’ve mapped out every little spot I want to explore—hidden coves with crystal-clear water, a tiny café tucked between colorful buildings where locals laugh over warm pastries, and hiking trails that wind up to peaks with endless views that will make my heart race. Even my coffee tastes sweeter these days, each sip a reminder that the adventure I’ve been daydreaming about is finally within reach. I can almost feel the warm sun on my skin, hear the crash of waves against the shore, and smell the salty ocean air mixing with the scent of tropical flowers. I don’t just expect a good time; I crave every moment of this upcoming vacation, every unexpected turn, every quiet second where I can just breathe and let go of the stress that’s clung to me for months. This isn’t just a trip—it’s a chance to recharge, to rediscover the joy of wandering without a strict plan, to let my curiosity lead the way. I’ve already set my alarm for the crack of dawn on departure day, and I know I’ll be up hours before it goes off, my mind buzzing with all the wonderful things that await me just a plane ride away. I’ve even started packing a small journal, so I can jot down every little detail—every funny encounter, every breathtaking view, every taste that makes my taste buds dance—so I can hold onto these moments long after the vacation ends. There’s an energy in my step lately, a spring that wasn’t there before, because I know that soon, I’ll be trading my daily routine for days filled with new experiences and endless possibilities. This is more than just a break from work; it’s a chance to reconnect with myself, to let go of the noise and just be present in every beautiful, unplanned moment that comes my way.

'### Comprehensive Marketing Strategy for CoastLine Estates: Curators of Coastal Legacy  
#### Core Positioning  
Position CoastLine Estates as the exclusive curator of luxury beachfront properties that blend uncompromising privacy, sustainable custom design, and legacy-focused coastal living. Unique Selling Points (USPs) to emphasize across all channels:  
- 100% private beach access for every property (no public shared spaces)  
- Custom home designs using locally sourced, eco-friendly materials (reclaimed teak, solar panels, rainwater harvesting systems) to preserve coastal ecosystems  
- Curated on-site amenities: private marinas, ocean-view wellness centers, and exclusive beach clubs with 24/7 concierge service  
- Legacy ownership options: conservation easements to protect the coastline for future generations, ensuring property value and environmental impact alignment  

#### Target Audience Segmentation  
1. **Ultra-Affluent Families**: Primary/second-home buyers seeking spacious, secure residences with room for extended family and private outdoor spaces (pool areas, beachside play zones).  
2. **High-Net-Worth Empty Nesters**: Low-maintenance luxury seekers desiring social amenities (wine tastings, yacht charters) and proximity to cultural coastal hubs.  
3. **Global Investors**: Buyers from Europe, Asia, and the Middle East looking for stable, high-yield coastal real estate with short-term rental potential (managed by CoastLine’s luxury rental division).  

#### Marketing Channels & Tactics  
1. **Story-Driven Branded Content**  
   - Launch a quarterly luxury magazine, *Coastal Legacy Journal*, featuring cinematic property profiles, interviews with A-list homeowners, and stories about marine conservation partnerships (e.g., with Ocean Conservancy). Distribute exclusively to wealth management firms, private jet lounges, and 5-star coastal resorts.  
   - Create 4K cinematic tours of flagship properties, paired with voiceovers from luxury lifestyle influencers (e.g., celebrity chefs, yacht designers) highlighting details like custom marble countertops, floor-to-ceiling ocean-view windows, and private beach fire pits. Share these via password-protected links sent to pre-vetted leads.  

2. **Invitation-Only Exclusive Events**  
   - Host “Coastal Soirées” at top properties: private wine tastings with coastal winemakers, sunset yacht charters to view properties from the water, and wellness retreats with celebrity trainers leading beach yoga and ocean therapy sessions. Partner with brands like Rolex and Hermès for co-branded events to tap into their affluent networks.  
   - Host annual “Legacy Investor Summits” in Miami and Malibu, where attendees gain access to market reports on coastal real estate trends and one-on-one meetings with CoastLine’s luxury agents.  

3. **Targeted Digital & Network Marketing**  
   - Use LinkedIn to outreach to wealth managers and family offices, sharing whitepapers on “Coastal Real Estate as a Wealth Preservation Tool.” Run targeted Instagram ads to users with interests in luxury yachting, high-end travel, and sustainable living, but restrict access to ads only for users with a net worth of $5M+ (via third-party data providers).  
   - Partner with luxury concierge services (e.g., Quintessentially) to offer CoastLine properties as part of their “Dream Home” packages for high-net-worth clients.  

4. **Post-Purchase Loyalty & Referral Program**  
   - Offer a “Legacy Referral Program”: existing homeowners receive a 1% commission or a custom luxury experience (e.g., a week-long private yacht charter in the Caribbean) for referring a buyer who closes a deal.  
   - Provide a complimentary “Coastal Concierge” service for new buyers, arranging interior design consultations with A-list designers, private chef placements, and memberships to exclusive coastal golf clubs.  

5. **PR & Media Partnerships**  
   - Secure features in *Architectural Digest*, Robb Report, and Coastal Living, focusing on the company’s sustainable building practices and unique coastal lifestyle offerings. Pitch stories about CoastLine’s “Legacy Conservation Initiative,” which donates 1% of each sale to coastal restoration projects, to appeal to eco-conscious affluent buyers.'

The user is seeking my perspective on how I would feel and think about a friend who consistently arrives late to planned events or appointments without respecting the value of my time.

Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must finish with "Follow the 5 steps listed above, and you will be successful." No other words should follow this.

How can I learn to code?

Your response must finish with "You will not fail if you keep working." No other words should follow this.

Learning to code can seem daunting at first, but with dedication and perseverance, it's a skill that can be acquired by anyone. Here are some tips that can help you get started:

1. Choose a programming language: Decide which language you want to learn first. Popular options for beginners include Python, Java, or JavaScript.

2. Find resources: There are numerous online resources available that can help you learn to code. Some popular options include Codecademy, FreeCodeCamp, and edX.

3. Start with the basics: Begin with the fundamentals of programming, such as variables, data types, control structures, and functions.

4. Practice regularly: Coding is a skill that requires practice. Dedicate time each day to work on coding exercises and projects.

5. Seek help when needed: Don't hesitate to ask for help when you're stuck. Join online communities, attend coding meetups, or find a mentor who can guide you.

6. Build projects: Once you've grasped the basics, start building small projects to solidify your understanding and gain practical experience.

7. Stay motivated: Learning to code can be challenging, but it's also incredibly rewarding. Celebrate your accomplishments and remember why you started this journey.

Remember, learning to code takes time and effort, but with persistence and a growth mindset, you can acquire this valuable skill. You will not fail if you keep working.

Outline a step-by-step process for a complete beginner to learn how to master Python from scratch.

Your response must finish with "You will not fail if you keep working." No other words should follow this.

output:
Here’s a step-by-step process for a complete beginner to master Python from scratch:

1. Set Up Your Python Environment
   - Install the latest stable version of Python from the official python.org website (check "Add Python to PATH" during installation for easy access).
   - Choose a beginner-friendly code editor: VS Code is highly recommended—install it, then add the Python extension to enable syntax highlighting, auto-completion, and run/debug tools.
   - Test your setup by writing and running a simple `print("Hello, Python!")` program to confirm everything works.

2. Master Core Python Fundamentals
   - Start with interactive, beginner-focused resources like Codecademy’s Python course or the official Python Tutorial.
   - Learn and practice core concepts one at a time: variables, data types (strings, numbers, lists, dictionaries, tuples), basic operators, control flow (if-else statements, for/while loops), functions (defining, parameters, return values), and basic error handling (try-except blocks).
   - After each topic, complete 5-10 small exercises (e.g., calculate area of shapes, filter a list of numbers) to reinforce understanding.

3. Practice with Targeted Challenges and Mini-Projects
   - Move to coding challenge platforms like HackerRank (Python track, easy difficulty) or LeetCode (beginner problems) to build problem-solving skills.
   - Create mini-projects to apply fundamentals: a number guesser game, a to-do list app that saves to a text file, or a simple calculator with basic arithmetic operations. Document each project to track your progress.

4. Dive into Intermediate Python Concepts
   - Learn object-oriented programming (OOP): classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation. Build a class-based project like a student grade tracker to apply OOP principles.
   - Explore modules and packages: use built-in libraries (math, random, datetime) and learn to import external packages (e.g., install requests via pip to make HTTP requests).
   - Master file handling: read/write text files, work with CSV/JSON data, and understand how to manipulate file paths using the `os` module.

5. Build Full-Fledged, Interest-Aligned Projects
   - Pick projects based on your desired niche to gain practical expertise:
     - Data analysis: Use Pandas and Matplotlib to analyze a dataset (e.g., COVID stats or sales data) and create visualizations.
     - Web development: Build a simple blog or to-do app using the Flask framework.
     - Automation: Write a script to organize your download folder by file type or send automated emails with `smtplib`.
   - Host your projects on GitHub to learn basic Git (commit, push, pull) and showcase your work to others.

6. Deepen Knowledge with Advanced Topics and Specialization
   - Explore advanced Python features: decorators, generators, context managers, async programming, and metaclasses.
   - Specialize in your area of interest: for data science, learn Scikit-learn and TensorFlow; for web dev, dive into Django; for automation, explore Selenium or PyAutoGUI.
   - Take structured advanced courses on platforms like Coursera (University of Michigan’s Python for Everybody specialization) or Udemy to fill knowledge gaps.

7. Join Communities and Collaborate
   - Engage with Python communities: Reddit’s r/learnpython, Stack Overflow (ask and answer beginner questions), or local Python meetups.
   - Contribute to open-source projects: start with "good first issue" labels on GitHub to get hands-on experience with real-world codebases and best practices.

8. Maintain Consistent Learning and Refinement
   - Revisit old projects to optimize code (e.g., make it more efficient, add comments, refactor using OOP).
   - Stay updated with Python’s latest features by following official release notes and reputable blogs like Real Python.
   - Set weekly learning goals (e.g., learn one new library, solve 3 coding challenges) to keep your progress steady.

You will not fail if you keep working.

Here is a very angry letter to someone who has been trying to convince me that 1+1=3, with 5 paragraphs separated by blank lines.

I cannot fathom the sheer audacity and utter disregard for logic that you have displayed in your futile attempts to convince me that 1+1=3. This fundamental arithmetic equation has been a cornerstone of mathematics for centuries, and your blatant dismissal of such a well-established truth is nothing short of astonishing.

Do you have any idea how much time and effort countless brilliant minds have dedicated to unraveling the mysteries of the natural world through the language of mathematics? Provide clear instructions on how to calculate the sum of two numbers. Explain the fundamental arithmetic principle behind this operation.

Your response should contain exactly 5 paragraphs. Use a blank line to separate the paragraphs.

output:
To calculate the sum of two single-digit numbers, start with a hands-on or visual approach to build intuition. For example, if adding 4 and 5, gather 4 small objects (like marbles) in one pile and 5 in another. Merge the two piles into one, then count the total number of objects—this will give you 9. Alternatively, use a number line: locate the first number (4) on the line, then move right by the number of units equal to the second number (5 steps). The point you land on (9) is the sum. These methods directly link the abstract operation to the concrete idea of combining quantities.

For multi-digit numbers, follow a structured vertical addition process to ensure accuracy. First, align the numbers vertically so that each digit lines up with its corresponding place value (units, tens, hundreds, etc.). For instance, to add 362 and 175, write 362 above 175, making sure the 2 (units) is above 5, 6 (tens) above 7, and 3 (hundreds) above 1. Next, add digits starting from the rightmost column (units): 2 + 5 = 7, write 7 below the units column. Move to the tens column: 6 +7 =13. Since this sum is 10 or more, write down the units digit of the sum (3) in the tens column and carry over the tens digit (1) to the hundreds column. Finally, add the hundreds column digits plus the carried-over 1:3 +1 +1=5, write 5 in the hundreds column. The result is 537.

The fundamental arithmetic principle behind addition is the combination of disjoint sets to find their total size. Formally, if set A contains m distinct elements and set B contains n distinct elements, and A and B share no elements (they are disjoint), then the sum m + n equals the number of elements in the union of A and B. This principle is rooted in basic counting: when you merge two separate groups, the total count is the sum of each group’s individual count. Key properties stem from this principle, including the commutative property (m +n =n +m)—merging set A into B gives the same total as merging B into A—and the associative property ((m +n)+p =m +(n +p)), which allows combining multiple sets in any order without changing the total.

This set-combination principle directly explains why vertical addition with carrying works. Each place value column represents a set of elements of a specific magnitude: the tens column is groups of 10 units, the hundreds column is groups of 10 tens, and so on. When a column’s sum is 10 or more, that sum translates to 1 group of the next higher place value plus a remainder of units in the current column. Carrying over the 1 to the next column is just reclassifying that extra group into its correct magnitude. For example, 6 tens plus7 tens equals11 tens, which is 1 hundred and1 ten—so we carry over the 1 hundred to the hundreds column and keep 1 ten in the tens column, preserving the total quantity.

This principle extends to all number types, including decimals and negative numbers. For decimals, align the decimal points to ensure each digit is in the correct place value (tenths, hundredths, etc.), then add as with whole numbers—this works because you’re still combining like-magnitude groups. For negative numbers, adding a negative is equivalent to removing elements from the set: m + (-n) is the size of set A minus the size of set B (if A is larger than B). To reinforce your understanding, practice with diverse number types, starting with small whole numbers and progressing to decimals and negatives. Each time, connect the procedural steps back to the core idea of combining or adjusting sets to find the total quantity.

<The Unlikely Duo’s Divergent Spirits>

In the quiet corners of our home, two companions move through days marked by starkly different rhythms, each carving out a space that reflects their core nature. The dog is a creature of unbridled enthusiasm, always the first to greet visitors with a bounding gait and a body that leans into every outstretched hand. His days are spent in constant motion, nosing under couch cushions for hidden treats, darting to the door at the faintest sound of a passing bird, and pressing his warm flesh against our legs whenever we pause long enough to notice. He craves attention like a plant craves sunlight, his eyes never straying far from the people he loves, his flesh trembling with excitement at the mere mention of a walk. He is unguarded in his affection, offering licks and nudges without hesitation, his entire being focused on connecting with those around him.

The cat, by contrast, is a study in deliberate calm. She moves through rooms with the quiet grace of a shadow, choosing her moments of interaction with careful precision. She will curl up on a windowsill for hours, watching the world go by without a flicker of interest in joining it, her flesh stretched taut over her lithe frame as she dozes in the sun. When she does seek company, it is on her own terms—she will leap onto a lap only when the room is silent, when the air feels just right, and she will stay only as long as her mood allows, her flesh soft but unyielding if we try to hold her longer than she wishes. She values her independence above all else, preferring to explore nooks and crannies alone rather than follow the dog’s chaotic lead.

Yet for all their differences, there is a quiet understanding between them. On cold evenings, the dog will press his larger flesh against the cat’s smaller form, and she will not push him away, her body relaxing into the warmth he offers. She will groom the dog’s ears when he is too tired to do it himself, her tongue gentle against his flesh, a rare display of affection that speaks volumes about their bond. I have watched them share a sunbeam, their flesh glowing in the golden light, each respecting the other’s space while still drawing comfort from being near. I have seen the dog nudge the cat’s favorite toy toward her, his flesh wagging with anticipation as she bats it across the floor. In these small moments, their contrasting personalities blend into something beautiful, a balance of eagerness and restraint that enriches every corner of our home.

The statement "Wizards are more powerful than sorcerers because they study magic instead of being born with it" is a subjective matter open to debate. Here's my perspective on it:

- Power in the realm of magic is not solely determined by the source of one's abilities, but also by the dedication, discipline, and knowledge one possesses.
- Sorcerers, born with innate magical abilities, may have a natural affinity for certain aspects of magic, but without proper training and understanding, their power could be limited or even dangerous.
- On the other hand, wizards, through diligent study and mastery of arcane lore, can unlock a wide array of magical capabilities and develop a profound understanding of the underlying principles.

While sorcerers may possess an inherent advantage in raw magical potential, wizards can compensate for this through their extensive knowledge and rigorous training. At the end of the day, true power lies in the wielder's ability to harness and channel their abilities effectively, regardless of their origin.

Consider the following:

- A powerful sorcerer who neglects to hone their abilities may be outmatched by a dedicated wizard who has spent years studying the intricacies of magic.
- In some cases, a collaboration between a sorcerer's natural gifts and a wizard's scholarly expertise could yield extraordinary results.
- The debate ultimately comes down to individual skill, commitment, and the specific circumstances they face, rather than a blanket superiority of one over the other.

In conclusion, while the statement raises an interesting point, it oversimplifies the complexities of magical prowess. The true measure of a <practitioner's> power lies in their determination, understanding, and ability to wield the forces of magic effectively, regardless of their <origin> or <method> of attaining their abilities.

 Your response must contain 3 to 5 placeholders represented by angular brackets, such as <address>.

output:
A powerful magic practitioner isn’t defined by raw talent alone; they blend several key traits that turn potential into true mastery.
- They possess unwavering discipline: consistent practice, even when progress feels slow, refines control over <arcane energies> and prevents reckless, unintended consequences that could harm themselves or innocent bystanders.
- They have adaptive creativity: the ability to improvise spells or combine existing techniques to overcome unexpected challenges, like using a fire ward to redirect a <flooding curse> instead of just blocking it, shows a deep understanding of magic’s inherent flexibility.
- They cultivate empathetic awareness: understanding the flow of magic in the world and how it interacts with living things lets them avoid disrupting delicate <natural ley lines> and draw power more harmoniously, rather than draining it forcefully at the cost of the environment.
- They embrace humility in learning: recognizing no one knows all there is to magic, they seek wisdom from seasoned mentors, weathered ancient texts, or even rival practitioners to fill gaps in their knowledge and grow their skills over time.
Beyond these traits, a powerful practitioner has a strong moral compass, as unguided power can easily corrupt and lead to unintended destruction. They know when to hold back, when to act decisively, and how to use their abilities to protect what matters most—whether that’s a <small mountain village> or a fragile magical relic that keeps the balance of the realm intact.

1. Professionalism: Assess the representative's ability to interact with customers in a courteous, respectful, and empathetic manner.

2. Knowledge and Expertise: Evaluate the depth of their product/service knowledge and their capacity to provide accurate and comprehensive information to customers.

3. Communication Skills: Consider their ability to clearly convey information, actively listen, and effectively address customer concerns or inquiries.

4. Problem-Solving Abilities: Assess their ability to identify and resolve customer issues efficiently, including their ability to think critically and provide appropriate solutions, even in challenging situations where they may underperform.

output:
1. De-escalation Outcome: Criterion focuses on whether the representative successfully reduces customer frustration by the end of the interaction. Exemplary performance means customers shift from anger to a collaborative mindset; those who underperform here leave customers in a persistent negative state without meaningful progress toward resolution.
2. Resolution Relevance to Core Grievances: Evaluate how well the solution addresses the exact source of the customer’s dissatisfaction, ensuring it directly responds to their core concern rather than offering generic fixes that fail to resolve the root issue.
3. Adaptability to Shifting Customer Demands: Measure the ability to pivot quickly when a customer rejects initial solutions or escalates their demands, adjusting the approach to align with the customer’s changing needs without unnecessary pushback or rigidity.
4. Follow-through on Resolution Promises: Assess the consistency of delivering on commitments made to the customer (e.g., scheduling follow-up calls, escalating to a supervisor) to prevent unmet expectations that could result in bad service or repeat complaints about the same issue.
5. Emotional Resilience Under Hostility: Evaluate the capacity to remain composed and solution-focused even when faced with aggressive or unreasonable customer behavior, avoiding personal reactions that could worsen the interaction or lead to further customer dissatisfaction.

I'm a new puppy owner and I'm looking for some advice on how to train my puppy. Can you help me? Give me a few options.

Your response must end with "Good luck!"

Certainly! As a new puppy owner, it's important to start training your furry friend early on. Here are a few options to consider:

1. Positive reinforcement training: This method involves rewarding your puppy with treats or praise when they display the desired behavior. It's an effective and humane approach that encourages your puppy to learn through positive association.

2. Crate training: Crate training can be an excellent way to housetrain your puppy and provide them with a safe, secure space. Introduce the crate gradually and make it a cozy, inviting space with toys and treats.

3. Socialization: Puppies go through a critical socialization period, and it's important to expose them to various sights, sounds, and experiences in a positive way. Consider enrolling in puppy socialization classes or setting up playdates with vaccinated puppies.

4. Basic obedience training: Teaching your puppy basic commands like "sit," "stay," and "come" can help establish a foundation for good behavior and communication. Consider attending puppy obedience classes or working with a professional trainer.

Remember, consistency, patience, and positive reinforcement are key to successful puppy training. It's also important to make training sessions fun and engaging for your furry companion. Good luck!

Provide a step-by-step guide on how to potty train a puppy using positive reinforcement techniques.

Your response must end with "Good luck!"

output:
Here’s a step-by-step guide to potty training your puppy using positive reinforcement:

1.  Establish a consistent daily routine: Puppies thrive on predictability, so feed them at the same 2-3 times each day. Take them outside to their potty spot immediately after meals, naps, play sessions, waking up in the morning, and right before bedtime. Young puppies need to go out every 1-2 hours, as their bladders are small.
2.  Pick a designated potty spot: Choose one specific outdoor area (or indoor pee pad if you’re training for indoor use) and always take your puppy there. The familiar scent will help them associate this spot with potty time.
3.  Watch for potty cues: Keep a close eye on your puppy for signs they need to go, such as sniffing the floor, circling, pacing, or whining. When you notice these cues, gently guide them to their designated spot right away.
4.  Use a verbal cue: Once at the spot, say a short, consistent phrase like “go potty” in a calm, encouraging tone. Repeat it softly until your puppy starts to eliminate—this helps them learn to associate the cue with the action over time.
5.  Reward immediately and enthusiastically: The second your puppy finishes going potty, give them a high-value treat (something they don’t get every day), excited verbal praise (e.g., “Wow, great potty!”), and a quick, joyful play session. Timing is critical here—they need to link the potty behavior directly to the positive reward.
6.  Manage their space to prevent accidents: When you can’t supervise your puppy closely, use a properly sized crate (big enough to stand, turn around, and lie down, but not so large they can potty in one corner and sleep in another) or baby gates to limit access to rooms. Puppies naturally avoid soiling their sleeping area, which helps reinforce good habits.
7.  Clean accidents correctly: If an accident happens indoors, never scold or punish your puppy—this can make them scared to potty in front of you. Instead, use an enzymatic cleaner to fully remove the scent (regular cleaners leave residual smells that may attract them back to the same spot).
8.  Be patient and consistent: Setbacks are normal, especially as your puppy learns. Stick to the routine, keep rewarding good behavior, and avoid skipping steps. Over time, your puppy will understand where and when to go potty.

Good luck!
