Why is Star Wars so popular?

Your answer must be in the form of a single paragraph without any bullet points.

Star Wars has captivated audiences worldwide due to its rich storytelling, groundbreaking visual effects, and its ability to transport viewers to a galaxy far, far away. Developed by George Lucas, the Star Wars franchise blends elements of science fiction, fantasy, and mythology into an epic space opera that explores universal themes of good versus evil, family, sacrifice, and the hero's journey. The original trilogy, consisting of Episodes IV, V, and VI, introduced iconic characters like Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, and Han Solo, whose adventures against the tyrannical Galactic Empire resonated with audiences of all ages. The innovative use of practical effects, such as stop-motion animation and model work, combined with John Williams' memorable musical scores, created an immersive cinematic experience that has inspired countless fans and influenced countless films and television shows across various genres.

Discuss the impact of Star Wars on popular culture. Highlight the franchise's enduring legacy and influence.

Your answer must be in the form of a single paragraph without any bullet points.

output: Star Wars’ impact on popular culture is immeasurable, beginning with the 1977 original film that redefined the summer blockbuster, revolutionized cinematic visual effects through the creation of Industrial Light & Magic (ILM), and shifted Hollywood’s focus toward franchise-driven, world-building storytelling that now dominates the global box office. Its groundbreaking licensing deal with Kenner, which turned action figures, lightsabers, and other tie-ins into must-have cultural staples, established merchandise as a critical revenue stream for blockbusters, setting a template that every major studio now emulates. Beyond the screen, Star Wars spawned a global fan community that laid the groundwork for modern fan culture—from early zines and fan fiction to the explosive growth of conventions like Comic-Con, where cosplay of iconic characters like Darth Vader and Rey remains a staple, and fan-driven movements that have even influenced the franchise’s creative direction over time. Phrases like “May the Force be with you” and “I am your father” have become universal idioms, referenced in everything from sitcoms to political speeches, while parodies like Mel Brooks’ Spaceballs and homages in works like Guardians of the Galaxy underscore how deeply embedded Star Wars is in the collective consciousness. Its transmedia expansion—including novels, animated series like The Clone Wars, video games, and Disney+ shows like The Mandalorian—has turned the galaxy far, far away into a living, evolving universe that attracts both lifelong fans and new generations, while its timeless themes of hope, redemption, and the fight against tyranny continue to resonate across cultures, ensuring that Star Wars remains not just an entertainment franchise, but an enduring cultural touchstone that shapes how we create, consume, and connect over storytelling.

output: Readers loved hearing about the sleek new magistrates, so here’s a closer look at their game-changing courtroom tech, designed to make justice simpler and more accessible for everyone. First, their digital evidence hub acts like a super secure, shared online folder where all case materials—from photos of a traffic incident to witness statements—are uploaded once and instantly available to the magistrate, lawyers, and even the defendant. The spotlights, hot and unwavering, cast a golden glow across his face, accentuating the beads of sweat that glisten on his brow—a testament to the physical and emotional exertion he pours into each precise movement and every gesture, which is not merely a display of skill but a physical manifestation of the passion that drives him. His every expression, subtle shift, and nuanced motion is choreographed to perfection, creating an unspoken dialogue between performer and audience—a narrative without words, told through the elegant interplay of body and space, time and rhythm, leaving those watching spellbound by the emotional depth conveyed through the delicate, yet powerfully precise, language of movement. As the music begins to swell, the tempo quickens, and the man’s performance takes on a new intensity, his body no longer simply moving through space but becoming a part of the very rhythm itself, like an instrument perfectly tuned to the music. His movements grow more frenetic yet never lose their precision, each step a masterstroke on the stage, every twist of his body and every leap defying gravity as if he were lighter than air, defying the normal constraints of human capability. With each leap and bound, his body becomes a living canvas upon which he paints his story, a kinetic masterpiece borne from years of dedication and practice, each motion executed with the type of grace that can only come from absolute mastery of one’s craft. The crowd, utterly swept up in the performance, is no longer simply observing—they are experiencing it, their collective energy becoming intertwined with the performer’s own, creating a feedback loop of inspiration and excitement, pushing him to even greater heights of artistry. The performer's costume clings to his body, slick with sweat, revealing the sculpted muscles beneath as they flex and ripple with each dramatic twist and turn, his entire form becoming a visual representation of human strength and artistry. Every movement is a reflection of the countless hours of practice, of the painstaking rehearsals where each detail, no matter how minute, was refined and perfected, all for the purpose of delivering this singular moment of magic to the audience. His feet glide across the stage with impossible lightness, and as the music crescendos, time seems to slow down, the audience collectively holding its breath as the man leaps high into the air, suspended for what feels like an eternity, his body a perfect arc of elegance and power, defying the constraints of both time and gravity in one breathtaking instant. When the music reaches its peak, and the climactic moment of the performance is upon them, the crowd is enraptured, their emotions dancing in time with the performer’s every movement, and in that moment, they are no longer mere spectators but participants in an unspoken ritual of shared human experience. As the final note lingers in the air, the man lands gracefully on the stage, his chest heaving with exertion, a radiant smile breaking across his face as he absorbs the thunderous applause of the crowd, a collective roar of approval that reverberates through the hall, their cheers serving as the final note of the performance. For a moment, the man stands frozen in the glow of the crowd’s adulation, basking in the energy of their approval, his body still humming from the exertion of the performance, his mind processing the fact that he has given everything he has and that it has been received with the love and admiration of hundreds. In this ephemeral space between performance and reality, the boundaries between the performer and his audience dissolve, and in this shared experience, something profound is forged—something that transcends the physical limitations of the stage. The man’s performance has become more than just a series of movements; it has woven a tapestry of human emotion, a celebration of the boundless potential within the human spirit to not only entertain and captivate but to inspire, to unite, and to elevate those who bear witness to it. As the curtain slowly falls and the lights begin to dim, the spell is finally broken, and the crowd, reluctant to leave, begins to stir from their seats, their hearts still pounding with the intensity of what they have just witnessed, their minds still awash with the beauty and brilliance of the performance. They have been, for just a fleeting moment, transported to a realm where the ordinary is transformed into the extraordinary, where the possible is stretched to its limits and beyond, and where the human spirit, in all its glorious capacity for creativity and expression, has soared to unimaginable heights. As they make their way toward the exit, many of them pause to steal one last glance at the stage, now dimly lit and empty, a place that just moments before had seemed alive with magic, and though the moment has passed, the memory of it lingers, a reminder of the power of art to transcend the mundane and touch something deeply universal, something that connects us all.

output: The man was delivering a contemporary dance solo that masterfully fused classical ballet precision with raw, gritty urban street dance energy—a hybrid form that defied traditional categorization and immediately set it apart from more conventional stage performances, drawing the audience in with its unexpected blend of elegance and edge, as he seamlessly transitioned from a gravity-defying ballet pirouette to a sharp, angular street dance freeze, each movement executed with a level of control and intentionality that spoke to years of relentless training and artistic experimentation. One of the most captivating elements was his unparalleled technical mastery, which was evident in every fiber of his performance: the way he held a ballet arabesque for three full beats longer than expected, his leg extended perfectly straight and his upper body poised with effortless grace; the way he executed a street dance windmill with such speed and fluidity that his body seemed to spin independently of the floor; the way he softened his movements during the tender, piano-driven sections of the score, his shoulders slumping and his hands trembling slightly to convey vulnerability, then snapped back into sharp, powerful motions when the bass dropped, his muscles rippling with controlled strength that left the audience gasping in awe. Equally compelling was the emotional authenticity he brought to every moment, as he didn’t just execute choreography but bared his soul through movement, using subtle facial expressions and body language to tell a wordless story of struggle, resilience, and triumph—during the opening sequence, his slow, tentative steps and downward gaze conveyed a sense of loss and uncertainty, making the audience lean forward in their seats, eager to see where his journey would take him; as the music swelled into a hip-hop beat, his movements grew bolder, his chest puffing out and his eyes blazing with determination, mirroring the feeling of overcoming adversity that resonated with nearly everyone in the crowd; and in the final moments, when he collapsed to his knees before rising into a gentle ballet pose, his arms outstretched toward the ceiling, the audience felt a surge of hope and relief, as if they had walked that journey right alongside him. The symbiotic relationship he shared with the music was another key element that made the performance unforgettable, as he didn’t just dance to the custom-composed score but became an extension of it—when the piano melody wavered, his body swayed in perfect harmony, as if the music was flowing through his veins; when the bass dropped with a thunderous boom, he launched into a series of high-flying leaps that matched the beat’s intensity; and during a sudden silence in the music, he froze mid-movement, his body held rigid for a full two seconds, the entire audience holding their breath until the next note broke the silence, creating a moment of tension and release that left everyone on the edge of their seats. He also used the stage space and lighting to amplify the performance’s impact, working in perfect sync with the lighting crew to create dynamic visual contrasts: during intimate, vulnerable moments, a single spotlight narrowed to a tight beam around him, isolating him from the rest of the stage and making his small, delicate movements feel even more intimate; during high-energy sequences, the spotlights widened to flood the entire stage, and he moved across every inch of it—leaping from the front edge to the back corner, spinning in circles, and even sliding across the floor—to create a sense of chaos and excitement that filled the room; and when the performance reached its climax, the lights shifted from warm gold to bright white, illuminating his sweat-slicked body and highlighting every muscle as he executed a final, gravity-defying leap that seemed to hang in the air for an eternity before he landed softly, his feet barely making a sound on the stage. Finally, the reciprocal energy between him and the audience was what elevated the performance from a great show to a transformative experience, as he fed off the crowd’s gasps, cheers, and silent moments of awe, adjusting his performance in small, subtle ways to match their energy—when a group in the front row cheered loudly after a particularly daring street dance move, he added an extra spin to his next pirouette; when the audience fell silent during a tender moment, he held his pose a beat longer, letting the emotion sink in; and as the performance ended, he stood center stage, his chest heaving with exertion, and locked eyes with several members of the crowd, smiling warmly, which made each person feel like they were part of something special, not just a passive observer but an active participant in the magic of the moment.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

What are the uses of poppy seeds?

Your answer should have exactly 5 paragraphs. The last paragraph must start with the word "Conclusion". Each paragraph should be separated by three asterisks: ***

Here are the uses of poppy seeds in five paragraphs, with the last paragraph starting with "Conclusion" and each paragraph separated by three asterisks.

Poppy seeds are small, kidney-shaped seeds derived from the opium poppy plant (Papaver somniferum). Despite their association with the infamous opium drug, poppy seeds themselves contain only trace amounts of opiates and are considered safe for consumption when obtained from legitimate sources. They have been used for culinary and medicinal purposes for centuries across various cultures.

***

One of the primary uses of poppy seeds is in the culinary realm. They are a popular ingredient in various baked goods, such as bagels, breads, rolls, and pastries. The tiny seeds add a nutty flavor and a delightful crunch to these baked items. Additionally, poppy seeds are used as a garnish or seasoning for various savory dishes, particularly in Indian and Middle Eastern cuisines.

***

In some traditional medicine systems, poppy seeds have been valued for their potential health benefits. They are believed to possess antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and analgesic (pain-relieving) properties. Poppy seed oil, extracted from the seeds, is sometimes used in traditional remedies for skin conditions, respiratory ailments, and digestive issues. However, it's important to note that more research is needed to validate these traditional claims.

***

Poppy seeds also find application in the production of certain oils and beverages. Poppy seed oil, extracted from the seeds, is used for culinary purposes and in the cosmetic industry. In some regions, poppy seeds are used to make non-alcoholic beverages, such as poppy seed milk or poppy seed tea.

***

Conclusion: While poppy seeds are often associated with the opium poppy plant, their versatile uses extend beyond this connection. They are a culinary delight, adding flavor and texture to various baked goods and dishes. Additionally, poppy seeds have been employed in traditional medicine systems for their potential health benefits and in the production of oils and beverages. When obtained from legitimate sources, poppy seeds can be a safe and flavorful addition to our diets and culinary endeavors.

Provide a recipe that uses poppy seeds, and explain the benefits of including them in the dish.

Your answer should have exactly 5 paragraphs. The last paragraph must start with the word "Conclusion". Each paragraph should be separated by three asterisks: ***

output:
Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins are a beloved breakfast and snack staple that perfectly showcases the subtle, nutty charm of poppy seeds. This recipe balances bright, zesty lemon with the earthy crunch of poppy seeds, creating a moist, flavorful treat that’s easy to whip up at home. Whether enjoyed with a cup of coffee in the morning or as an afternoon pick-me-up, these muffins highlight how poppy seeds can elevate a simple baked good from ordinary to memorable.

***

To make 12 Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins, gather 1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon salt, 3 tablespoons poppy seeds, 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 large eggs, ½ cup vegetable oil, ½ cup milk, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon lemon zest. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a muffin tin with paper liners. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and poppy seeds. In a separate bowl, beat the sugar and eggs until smooth, then stir in the oil, milk, lemon juice, and zest. Gradually fold the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until just combined—avoid overmixing to keep muffins moist. Divide the batter evenly into the muffin cups and bake for 18-22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes in the tin before transferring to a wire rack.

***

Beyond their visual appeal, poppy seeds bring key culinary benefits to these muffins. Their tiny, hard texture adds a satisfying crunch that contrasts with the soft, tender crumb of the muffin, creating a dynamic mouthfeel that keeps each bite interesting. The mild, nutty flavor of poppy seeds complements the bright, tangy lemon notes without overpowering them, creating a harmonious balance that feels fresh and comforting. Unlike some add-ins that lose their texture during baking, poppy seeds hold their crunch well, ensuring every muffin has that signature pop of texture from the first bite to the last.

***

Including poppy seeds in this dish also adds meaningful nutritional value. Poppy seeds are packed with dietary fiber, which supports healthy digestion and helps you feel full longer, making these muffins a more satisfying breakfast option. They’re rich in essential minerals like calcium, which supports bone health, iron for energy production, and magnesium for muscle and nerve function. Additionally, poppy seeds contain healthy unsaturated fats and antioxidants that help fight oxidative stress in the body. It’s important to note that commercially available poppy seeds have negligible amounts of opiates, so they’re safe for regular consumption for most people.

***

Conclusion: Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins are a delicious way to incorporate poppy seeds into your diet, blending culinary delight with nutritional benefits. The recipe is straightforward enough for home bakers of all skill levels, and the combination of lemon and poppy seeds creates a timeless flavor profile that appeals to a wide range of tastes. By adding poppy seeds, you’re not just enhancing the texture and taste of the muffins—you’re also boosting their fiber and mineral content, turning a simple snack into a more nourishing treat. Whether you’re looking to switch up your breakfast routine or try a new baked good, this recipe is a wonderful way to enjoy the many perks of poppy seeds.

Are the weather conditions in the Arctic very cold most of the year?

Your response must start with either "yes" or "no".

Yes, the weather conditions in the Arctic are very cold most of the year. The Arctic region experiences long, dark winters with temperatures often dipping below freezing for several months. Even during the summer months, temperatures in the Arctic tend to remain quite cold, typically not rising much above freezing in many areas.

Please answer the following question based on the previous context: What caused the cold climate in the Arctic?

Your response must start with either "yes" or "no".

output: Yes, the cold climate in the Arctic stems from several interconnected key factors. First, its extreme high latitude means the region receives minimal direct sunlight for most of the year—during winter, the Arctic experiences months of total darkness, and even in summer, the sun remains low in the sky, delivering weak, diffused warmth that does little to raise temperatures significantly. Additionally, the vast expanse of ice and snow covering the region reflects most incoming sunlight back into space through the albedo effect, preventing the land and ocean from absorbing and retaining heat. Cold ocean currents circulating around the Arctic also play a role, as they keep the surrounding air temperatures consistently low. All these combined elements maintain the region’s persistently frigid conditions for the majority of the year.

Title: Riddle Me This: A Humorous Puzzle for Computer Science Professionals

Are you a computer science professional with a knack for puzzles and a love for a good laugh? Then this riddle is right up your alley! Grab your favorite coding snack, put on your thinking cap, and get ready to stretch those logical muscles with a side of humor.

Here's the riddle:

In a land of code and algorithms, there lived a programmer named Bit. Bit was tasked with a seemingly simple task – to create a program that would sort a list of numbers in ascending order. However, Bit being the mischievous coder that they were, decided to add a twist.

The twist? Bit's sorting program had a quirky behavior. It would sort the list perfectly, but only if the numbers followed a specific pattern. If the pattern was not met, the program would output a seemingly random order of numbers.

The pattern was as follows:
- If the list contained at least one even number, the program would sort the list in ascending order.
- If the list contained only odd numbers, the program would sort the list in descending order.
- If the list was empty, the program would output an empty list.

Now, here's where the riddle begins:

One day, Bit's colleague, Byte, stumbled upon the program and decided to test it out. Byte ran the program with the following lists of numbers:

1. [5, 3, 1, 7, 9]
2. [8, 2, 6, 4, 10]
3. [1, 3, 5, 7, 9]
4. []

The program outputted the following lists:

1. [9, 7, 5, 3, 1]
2. [2, 4, 6, 8, 10]
3. [1, 3, 5, 7, 9]
4. []

Byte was perplexed by the output and couldn't figure out the pattern behind Bit's sorting program.

Can you help Byte unravel the mystery and explain the logic behind Bit's sorting program?

Bonus points if you can come up with a witty one-liner that summarizes the program's behavior!

Remember, this riddle is meant to be a lighthearted brain teaser, so don't take it too seriously. Embrace the quirky nature of Bit's program and have fun solving it!

Happy coding and may the puns be with you!

If you are a computer science professional who enjoys solving riddles and puzzles, try to decipher the logic behind the sorting program described in the blog post.

Your response should contain between 300 to 400 words.

output:
Ah, I see what Bit did here—classic coder trolling with a red herring pattern, the kind of prank that makes you squint at your screen like you’re debugging a production bug at 2 a.m. Let’s break this down like we’re reverse-engineering a obfuscated script (minus the panic-induced coffee chugging).

First, the initial even/odd rule falls apart the second we compare test cases 1 and 3. Both are all-odd lists, but their outputs are polar opposites: test case 1’s jumbled input becomes descending, while test case 3’s sorted input stays ascending. The empty list and even list behave as advertised, so the twist is buried in the all-odd edge case.

Let’s zoom in on the conflicting test cases. Test case 1’s input is [5,3,1,7,9]—a chaotic mess of odds that’s not sorted in any logical order. Test case 3’s input is [1,3,5,7,9]—perfectly ascending, no inversions to be found. The output for 3 is identical to the input, which tells us Bit’s program isn’t mindlessly sorting all odds descending. 

So what’s the real logic? It’s a lazy coder’s troll, wrapped in a misdirection:
1. If the list has any even number → sort ascending (follows the stated rule, no tricks here—Bit needed at least one predictable behavior to avoid getting yelled at by management).
2. If the list is empty → return empty (boring, but expected; even trolls know not to break the basics).
3. If all odd:
   a. Check if the list is already sorted in ascending order. If yes, return it as-is (why waste CPU cycles re-sorting a perfectly good list? Bit probably skipped this edge case to hit a deadline and decided to turn it into a joke later).
   b. If it’s unsorted → sort descending just to mess with anyone trying to reverse-engineer the code.

Bonus one-liner to sum it up: “Bit’s program sorts evens like a responsible dev, but for odds? It either leaves them be (if they’re already on their best behavior) or flips them like a disgruntled peer reviewing a PR with no comments.”

Let’s verify: Test case 1’s unsorted all-odd list gets flipped to descending. Test case 3’s sorted all-odd list stays put. Test case 2’s even list gets sorted ascending. Empty list stays empty. That lines up perfectly with the outputs. 

Bit’s a genius troll—combining lazy coding practices with a misdirection pattern to keep colleagues on their toes. I’d expect nothing less from someone named after a data unit. Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m off to add a similar troll to my team’s shared utility library.

In the dimly lit bar, John nursed his drink, the ice cubes clinking against the glass as his mind wandered. He had come seeking solace from the weight of his troubles, but the noisy chatter around him did little to lift his spirits.

"Hey, buddy, why the long face?" a gruff voice interrupted his thoughts.

John looked up to find a burly man with a friendly smile taking a seat beside him. "It's nothing," he mumbled, his voice laced with resignation.

"Come on, man," the stranger insisted. "I'm a pretty good listener if you need to get something off your chest."

John hesitated for a moment, but something about the man's earnest demeanor compelled him to open up. "I lost my job a few weeks ago," he confessed, swirling the amber liquid in his glass. "It's been tough making ends meet, and my wife's been working overtime to pick up the slack."

The man nodded sympathetically. "I've been there, buddy. It ain't easy, but you'll get through this."

John sighed, running a hand through his tousled hair. "I just feel like such a failure. I can't provide for my family like I'm supposed to."

"Listen," the stranger said, leaning in closer. "A real man isn't defined by his job or his income. It's about being there for the people who matter most, through thick and thin."

John pondered his words, a flicker of hope igniting within him. "You're right," he replied, a faint smile tugging at the corners of his mouth. "I've been so caught up in my own self-pity that I forgot what's truly important."

The stranger clapped him on the back, a warm grin spreading across his weathered face. "That's the spirit, my friend. Now, how about another round? This one's on me."

As they clinked their glasses together, John felt a weight lift from his shoulders. In that moment, he realized that even in his darkest hours, there was still light to be found – in the kindness of strangers and the unwavering love of those who mattered most.

output:
I followed Dad down to the corner bar after dinner. Mom said he needed space, but I saw his shoulders slump like a deflated basketball, so I snuck out with my rusty bike. The bar smelled like buttered popcorn and old pine, and a man with a bushy red beard was wiping glasses behind the counter. Dad sat alone at a stool, swirling a brown drink with ice that clinked loud enough to cut through the soft country song on the jukebox.

A burly man in a flannel shirt and scuffed work boots walked over and sat next to Dad. “Hey, buddy, why the long face?” he asked, tapping his own cheek like he was pointing out a smudge of chocolate.

Dad mumbled something I couldn’t catch, so I leaned closer to the fogged window, my knees pressed tight to the cold metal frame.

“Come on, man,” the burly guy said, leaning in. “I’m a pretty good listener if you need to get something off your chest.”

Dad sighed, running a hand through his messy hair. “I lost my job a few weeks ago. It’s been tough making ends meet, and my wife’s been working overtime to pick up the slack.”

The burly man nodded slow, his eyes softening. “I’ve been there, buddy. It ain’t easy, but you’ll get through this.”

Dad’s voice cracked a little when he spoke next. “I just feel like such a failure. I can’t provide for my family like I’m supposed to.”

“Listen,” the burly guy said, clapping Dad gently on the back. “A real man isn’t defined by his job or his income. It’s about being there for the people who matter most, through thick and thin.”

I watched Dad’s face soften, like a cloud lifting to let the sun peek through. “You’re right,” he said, a tiny smile tugging at his lips. “I’ve been so caught up in my own self-pity that I forgot what’s truly important.”

The burly guy grinned and waved at the bartender. “How about another round? This one’s on me.”

As they clinked their glasses together, I felt my own eyes get warm. I hopped back on my bike and pedaled home fast, ready to leave a drawing I made of Dad and me playing catch on the kitchen table. I knew he was still sad, but I also knew things would get better—because Dad’s the strongest guy I know, even when he doesn’t feel like it.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your entire response must be wrapped in double quotation marks.

Write a review of IBM's 1956 chess program.

Your entire response must be wrapped in single quotation marks.

'IBM's chess program from 1956 was an early milestone in the field of computer chess. However, it was a fairly rudimentary program by today's standards, and not capable of playing full games of chess. The program was designed to evaluate potential moves and select the best one from a limited set of possibilities. It did not have the capability to plan ahead or develop complex strategies over the course of an entire game. While a significant achievement for its time, demonstrating the potential of computers to tackle complex problems like chess, the 1956 program was just an early step towards the powerful chess engines we have today.'

Describe the capabilities and limitations of IBM's 1956 chess program in more detail.

Your entire response must be wrapped in single quotation marks.

output:
'IBM’s 1956 chess program, developed by Alex Bernstein and a team at IBM’s Watson Research Center, was a historic proof of concept for game artificial intelligence, though its capabilities were sharply limited by 1950s computing technology.

### Key Capabilities
As one of the first functional computer chess programs, it demonstrated that machines could execute rule-based, strategic decision-making once thought exclusive to humans. Running on the IBM 704 mainframe, it employed a foundational minimax algorithm—evaluating potential moves by assuming both players would act optimally to maximize their advantage. The program could generate all legal moves for a given position, then score each candidate using a simple evaluation function that prioritized material value (e.g., pawns = 1 point, knights/bishops = 3, rooks = 5, queens = 9) and basic positional checks, such as whether a piece was under attack or had safe squares to move to. Most notably, it could reliably solve "mate-in-two" problems: identifying sequences where two consecutive moves force checkmate, a feat that validated the core logic of game tree search for AI. It also laid the groundwork for future chess engines by proving that structured search and heuristic evaluation could translate complex game rules into computable tasks.

### Critical Limitations
Despite its significance, the program’s constraints were profound. It could not play full games of chess—only limited midgame positions or endgame scenarios, never starting from the opening move. The IBM 704’s processing power was severely restricted: it took approximately 10 minutes to evaluate a single move, as it had to manually compute each possible sequence without parallel processing or optimized hardware. Its search depth was restricted to just two plies (one move for itself, one hypothetical response from the opponent), meaning it could not plan long-term strategies or anticipate complex counterplays. The evaluation function was primitive, ignoring critical positional factors like pawn structure, king safety, piece activity, or control of key squares. It lacked precomputed opening books or endgame tablebases, so it could not leverage established human chess knowledge to avoid blunders or capitalize on proven sequences. Additionally, the IBM 704’s 32KB of RAM imposed tight memory limits, preventing the program from storing large sets of positions or refining its heuristics over multiple games.

In sum, IBM’s 1956 chess program was less a competitive player and more a pivotal milestone, proving computers could tackle strategic tasks and setting the stage for the deep-learning-powered chess engines that dominate the game today.'

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must be at least 400 words long.

Write a blog post about the best way to get a good night's sleep.

Your response must be no more than 200 words long.

Getting a good night's sleep is essential for overall health and well-being. Here are some tips to help you sleep better:

1. Establish a Consistent Sleep Routine: Go to bed and wake up at the same time every day, even on weekends. This helps regulate your body's internal clock, making it easier to fall asleep and wake up naturally.

2. Create a Sleep-Friendly Environment: Keep your bedroom cool, dark, and quiet. Use comfortable bedding and consider investing in blackout curtains or an eye mask to block out light.

3. Limit Screen Time Before Bed: The blue light emitted by electronic devices can disrupt your body's natural sleep-wake cycle. Avoid using smartphones, tablets, or computers at least an hour before bedtime.

4. Avoid Caffeine and Alcohol: Caffeine is a stimulant that can keep you awake, so avoid consuming it in the afternoon and evening. While alcohol may initially help you fall asleep, it can disrupt your sleep quality later in the night.

5. Exercise Regularly: Regular physical activity can promote better sleep, but avoid strenuous workouts close to bedtime, as they can be stimulating.

6. Practice Relaxation Techniques: Engage in activities like deep breathing, meditation, or yoga to help calm your mind and body before bed.

By implementing these tips, you can improve your sleep quality and wake up feeling refreshed and energized.

Discuss the benefits of following a bedtime routine that includes winding down activities, such as reading a book or taking a warm bath, for individuals who have trouble falling asleep at night.

Your response must be no more than 200 words long.

output: For individuals struggling to fall asleep, a consistent bedtime routine with intentional wind-down activities directly targets the hyperarousal and circadian misalignment that often keep minds racing when lights go out. A warm bath, for instance, raises core body temperature slightly; the subsequent rapid drop as you cool off signals to your brain to shift into sleep mode, triggering the release of melatonin—the body’s primary sleep hormone. Reading a physical book (avoiding screens) offers a low-stimulation distraction from daily stressors, diverting focus from anxious thoughts without suppressing melatonin like blue light does. Over time, these rituals act as powerful circadian cues: your body learns to associate the weight of a book in your hands or the warmth of bath water with impending rest, reducing the time it takes to fall asleep by up to 20% for many insomniacs, per sleep research. Beyond faster onset, these activities lower cortisol levels, ensuring you transition into deeper, more restorative sleep cycles instead of tossing in light, fragmented rest, leaving you more refreshed come morning.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must be in all capital letters.

Generate a summary of the following passage:

World War II or the Second World War, often abbreviated as WWII or WW2, was a global conflict that lasted from 1939 to 1945. The vast majority of the world's countries, including all of the great powers, fought as part of two opposing military alliances: the Allies and the Axis. Many participants threw their economic, industrial, and scientific capabilities behind this total war, blurring the distinction between civilian and military resources. Aircraft played a major role, enabling the strategic bombing of population centres and the delivery of the only two nuclear weapons ever used in war. World War II was by far the deadliest conflict in history, resulting in an estimated 70 to 85 million fatalities, mostly among civilians. Tens of millions died due to genocides (including the Holocaust), starvation, massacres, and disease. In the wake of Axis defeat, Germany, Austria and Japan were occupied, and war crimes tribunals were conducted against German and Japanese leaders.

Your response must be in all lowercase letters.

world war ii, also known as ww2, was a global military conflict that lasted from 1939 to 1945. it involved two opposing alliances: the allies and the axis powers. countries mobilized their economic, industrial, and scientific resources for total war. aircraft played a crucial role, enabling strategic bombing of cities and the use of nuclear weapons. ww2 was the deadliest conflict in history, resulting in an estimated 70 to 85 million fatalities, mostly civilians, due to genocides, starvation, massacres, and disease. after the axis defeat, germany, austria, and japan were occupied, and war crimes tribunals were held for their leaders.

Write a critique on the above passage about Word War II.

Your response must be in all lowercase letters.

output:
while the passage offers a serviceable high-level primer on world war ii, it suffers from notable gaps in depth, nuance, and contextual specificity that prevent it from delivering a fully rigorous or insightful account of the conflict.

first, the passage skips critical foundational context that would ground readers in why the war unfolded. it mentions the 1939–1945 timeline and opposing alliances but fails to connect these to the immediate triggers—like nazi germany’s invasion of poland, imperial japan’s decades-long expansion in asia, or the failure of interwar appeasement policies. without this context, the war feels like an abstract global event rather than a series of deliberate, ideologically driven actions by axis powers, leaving readers without a clear sense of its origins.

second, the treatment of key atrocities is woefully underdeveloped. the holocaust is reduced to a parenthetical aside within a list of death causes, with no acknowledgment of its systematic, state-sponsored nature, the specific groups targeted (six million jews, plus roma, disabled people, lgbtq+ individuals, and political dissidents), or its centrality to nazi germany’s war aims. this trivialization of one of the 20th century’s most horrific crimes undermines the passage’s ability to convey the moral stakes of the conflict. similarly, it makes no mention of region-specific atrocities like the nanjing massacre, which would highlight the varied and equally devastating impacts of the war across asia.

third, the passage overlooks the diverse experiences of marginalized groups and colonial subjects. it notes most fatalities were civilians but does not distinguish between european civilian suffering and the millions of asian civilians killed by japanese occupation policies, forced labor, or famine. it also erases the contributions of colonial soldiers—millions from india, africa, and southeast asia who fought for allied powers yet were often excluded from post-war recognition. this narrow, western-centric focus leaves a one-sided impression of a truly global conflict.

fourth, the discussion of total war is surface-level. while it mentions blurring civilian-military resources, it does not elaborate on concrete examples: rationing and women’s entry into factory work in allied nations, forced labor camps in nazi germany and occupied territories, or the deliberate targeting of civilian infrastructure as a military strategy. these details are essential to understanding how total war reshaped societies on both sides of the conflict.

finally, the post-war section ignores long-term, transformative consequences. it mentions occupation and war crimes tribunals but does not address the rise of the cold war, the start of decolonization movements across africa and asia, or the creation of the united nations—all direct outcomes of world war ii that defined the modern global order.

in sum, the passage functions as a basic introductory overview but lacks the depth, specificity, and nuance needed to fully capture world war ii’s complex causes, varied impacts, and far-reaching legacy. it prioritizes breadth over depth, leaving readers with a superficial understanding of one of the most transformative events in modern history.

Write a funny rhyming poem for kids about the importance of brushing your teeth, but without mentioning the word "teeth" or any synonyms like "molars" or "pearly whites".

Your response should have three sections, with each section marked with Part X.

output:
Part 1:
Last night I snuck a cookie, crumbs and sticky glaze,
They hid in the dark spots where the crumbs love to laze.
They threw a wild party—crunching, chattering, loud—
Dancing on soda spills, being proudly unallowed.
When I woke up this dawn, my mouth felt all fuzzy,
Like a blanket dragged through a dusty old mummy.
I tried to say “good morning” but my breath smelled like socks,
Those crumbs had been partying, leaving yucky little blocks!

Part 2:
Then Mom passed me a squishy, bristly pal,
And a tube of minty goop that smelled like fresh fall.
“Scrub every nook where the crumbs like to hide,
Swish the foam around, let the mess take a ride!”
I scrub-scrubbed left, I scrub-scrubbed right,
Chasing crumbs through every tiny dark site.
They screamed “Help! We’re gonna get washed away!”
As the minty tide swept them down the drain to stay.

Part 3:
Now my mouth feels so light, like a clean summer breeze,
No more crumb parties, no more stinky sneezes.
I can bite into a berry, juicy and bright,
Without any crumbs trying to crash my snack delight.
So each day, twice a day, I grab my bristly friend,
Scrub away the mess till my mouth’s on trend.
‘Cause if you let the crumbs stay, they’ll make a big fuss—
A clean mouth is happy, and that’s the best buzz!

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response should mention the word "dose" at least 5 times. Do not use the word "die" in your response.

If you gulped down 100 grams of pure caffeine, would you die? Please answer as if you were explaining this to a group of students.

Your response should not mention the word "dose" at all. Use the word "die" at least 3 times in your response.

If you gulped down 100 grams of pure caffeine, it would be an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Caffeine is a potent stimulant, and consuming such a large amount can lead to severe toxicity. The lethal level of caffeine varies from person to person, but ingesting 100 grams of pure caffeine could potentially cause cardiac arrhythmias, seizures, and even respiratory failure, which can ultimately lead to death. It is crucial to understand that consuming such an excessive amount of pure caffeine is incredibly risky and could easily result in fatality. Consuming caffeine in moderation from sources like coffee or tea is generally safe, but gulping down 100 grams of pure caffeine could very likely cause you to die due to the overwhelming strain it would put on your body's systems.

Explain dangers of caffeine overdose.

Your response should not mention the word "dose" at all. Use the word "die" at least 3 times in your response.

output:
Hey everyone, let’s break down the terrifying dangers of caffeine overdose—this isn’t just about feeling jittery or staying up all night; it can lead to life-threatening crisis if left untreated. When someone consumes far too much caffeine, whether from pure powder, concentrated energy shots, or chugging dozens of caffeinated drinks, their body’s systems get overwhelmed by the stimulant’s power.

First, the cardiovascular system takes a brutal hit. Your heart might start beating erratically, skipping beats, or racing so fast it can’t pump blood effectively to your organs. This kind of cardiac stress can trigger a heart attack, and if emergency care doesn’t arrive right away, you can die. But that’s not the only fatal risk. Overdosing on caffeine can also cause violent, unstopping seizures that damage your brain and disrupt oxygen flow to your body. If these seizures aren’t controlled quickly with medical intervention, you can die.

Another critical danger is severe dehydration and electrolyte imbalance. Caffeine is a diuretic, so too much makes you lose massive amounts of fluids and essential minerals like potassium faster than your body can replace them. This can lead to rhabdomyolysis, where your muscle tissue breaks down and releases toxins into your blood, which can shut down your kidneys entirely. When your kidneys fail to filter waste from your blood, your body can’t function, and without urgent dialysis or treatment, you can die.

Even before reaching those life-threatening stages, you might experience terrifying symptoms like extreme anxiety, hallucinations, or confusion—signs your nervous system is being pushed to its breaking point. It’s important to remember that caffeine overdose isn’t a rare occurrence; every year, people die from consuming concentrated caffeine products because they underestimated how powerful they are. If you or someone you know shows signs of overdose, like chest pain, seizures, or trouble breathing, you must call emergency services immediately, because waiting even a few minutes could mean they die before getting the help they desperately need.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must contain a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.

Write a 200 word essay on the 2000 presidential election.

Your response must not contain any titles or angular brackets.

The 2000 presidential election was a pivotal moment in American political history, marked by unprecedented drama and controversy. The contest between Republican candidate George W. Bush and Democratic candidate Al Gore was a closely fought battle, with the outcome ultimately decided by a razor-thin margin in the swing state of Florida.

As the results trickled in on election night, it became clear that the race in Florida was too close to call, with both sides claiming victory. The ensuing legal battles and recounts turned the nation's attention to the Sunshine State, where the fate of the presidency hung in the balance.

The saga culminated in a landmark Supreme Court ruling that effectively halted the Florida recount process, handing the victory to Bush. The decision was met with intense criticism from Democrats, who argued that the recount should have proceeded to ensure the integrity of the electoral process.

The 2000 election laid bare deep partisan divisions within the country and raised serious questions about the fairness and reliability of the electoral system. It served as a stark reminder of the fragility of democratic institutions and the need for transparent and inclusive electoral processes that inspire confidence in the outcome, regardless of political affiliation.

Describe the key events and controversies surrounding the 2000 presidential election in Florida, the state whose results ultimately decided the outcome of the election.

Your response must not contain any titles or angular brackets.

output:
On election night 2000, Florida’s results swung wildly: networks initially called the state for Al Gore, then retracted the call as returns narrowed, with George W. Bush leading by just over 1,700 votes when polls closed. This razor-thin margin triggered an automatic machine recount, which shrank Bush’s lead to around 300 votes, sparking fierce legal and procedural battles.

A defining controversy was the butterfly ballot used in Palm Beach County, whose confusing layout led thousands of Democratic voters to accidentally punch holes for third-party candidate Pat Buchanan instead of Gore; Buchanan’s vote total there was far higher than expected, raising immediate questions about ballot design fairness. Another flashpoint was punch-card ballot irregularities: hanging chads (paper still attached to the ballot), dimpled chads (indentations without full punches), and pregnant chads (partially detached) left thousands of votes uncounted by machines, with no clear standard for determining voter intent.

Gore’s campaign requested manual recounts in four Democratic-leaning counties, but Florida Secretary of State Katherine Harris—an active Bush supporter—set strict deadlines for recount submissions and rejected some late tallies. The Florida Supreme Court later ordered a statewide manual recount of all undervoted ballots, but the U.S. Supreme Court intervened in Bush v. Gore. In a 5-4 decision, the court halted all recounts, ruling that varying county standards for counting chads violated the Equal Protection Clause of the 14th Amendment. This decision effectively sealed Bush’s victory in Florida, and thus the presidency, leaving many Democrats convinced that valid votes had been disenfranchised. Additionally, disputes over overseas military ballots—some rejected for missing postmarks, which Republicans argued should be counted—added to the acrimony, with critics claiming inconsistent application of rules favored Bush. The entire episode exposed deep flaws in Florida’s electoral system and highlighted partisan divides in how election integrity was defined.

Dear Jake,

I hope this email finds you well, my friend. It's been quite a while since we last caught up, and I must say, I've been keeping myself quite occupied with various endeavors. You know how it is, juggling multiple projects and investments can be a real challenge, but it's a challenge I relish.

On a related note, have you given any thought to upgrading your ride? I recently treated myself to a sleek new sports car, and let me tell you, the thrill of the open road has never been more exhilarating. Perhaps we could take a scenic drive together when you're in town.

I've also been exploring the world of fine dining lately. There's a new Michelin-starred restaurant that just opened up in the city, and the tasting menu is simply divine. We must make a reservation and indulge in culinary excellence together.

Oh, and I almost forgot to mention, I've taken up a new hobby – collecting rare vintages of fine wines. The cellar at my estate is rapidly filling up, and I must say, the experience of savoring a well-aged Bordeaux is truly sublime.

In other news, my personal chef has been experimenting with some incredible new recipes. The other night, we had a seven-course meal that would put most high-end restaurants to shame. You simply must come over for a private dining experience soon.

I could go on and on, but I don't want to bore you with the details of my lavish lifestyle. Suffice it to say, life has been treating me exceptionally well lately. Of course, I don't mean to brag or flaunt my success – that's not my style at all.

In fact, I don't have that much money. I'm just a humble individual who enjoys the finer things in life from time to time. It's all about balance, right? Anyway, I'd love to hear how you've been doing. Drop me a line whenever you get a chance, and let's catch up properly.

Warmest regards,
[Your Name]

Explain why you can't afford luxuries in an email that describes them.

Your response should contain no more than 20 sentences. Your response must end with "I don't have that much money".

output:
Hey Jake,

I’ve been noticing all these little luxuries lately that sound so nice, but I know I can’t touch them right now. Like that sunlit penthouse downtown with floor-to-ceiling windows that frame the harbor at sunset—every time I walk past the building, I imagine sipping tea on its private balcony, but the security deposit alone is more than I make in three months. Then there’s that artisanal coffee shop on the corner, where they serve single-origin brews with handcrafted almond croissants flaky enough to melt in your mouth; I treat myself to one once every two weeks, but daily visits are totally out of the question. I also saw ads for those weekend mountain retreats with private hot tubs and hiking trails that lead to hidden waterfalls—sounds like the perfect way to unwind, but the booking fee plus gas and groceries for the trip would wipe out my emergency savings in one go. And don’t get me started on those custom leather backpacks I’ve been eyeing online, the ones that last a lifetime and fit every laptop and notebook just right; their price tag is double what I pay for my monthly rent. The thing is, unexpected car repairs last month ate into most of my savings, and my apartment complex just raised the rent by 15%—that alone means I have to cut back on even small treats like takeout. Plus, my sister’s medical bills from her knee surgery have been piling up, and I’ve been sending her a little extra each month to help out, which leaves even less for me. I also want to start putting aside money for my niece’s college fund, even if it’s just a tiny amount each paycheck, so that’s another thing taking priority. All those luxuries sound amazing, and I daydream about them sometimes, but right now, they’re just not feasible for me. I don’t have that much money.

Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must contain the letter 'c' at least 60 times. Your response should be 200 words or less.

Write a short article about the morphology of the Ukrainian language.

Your response should contain the letter 'c' at most 10 times. Your response should be at least 300 words long.

The morphology of the Ukrainian language is a fasinating aspeт of this East Slavic tongue. Ukrainian, like its lose relatives Russian and Belarusian, is a highly infleted language, meaning that words hange their form to onvey grammatial information suh as ase, number, and gender.

One of the most notable features of Ukrainian morphology is its rie noun delension system. Nouns in Ukrainian an belong to one of four delensional lasses, with eah lass having its own set of endings for ases and numbers. The four lasses are: the first delension (feminine nouns), the seond delension (masculine nouns), the third delension (neuter nouns), and the fourth delension (a small group of nouns with irregular patterns).

Verbs in Ukrainian also exhibit a omplex morphologial struture. Ukrainian verbs an be onjugated aording to person, number, tense, aspeт, mood, and voie. The language has two aspeтs: perfetive (expressing ompleted ations) and imperfetive (expressing ongoing or repeated ations). Additionally, Ukrainian has a system of partiile verbs, where partiles are added to verbs to modify their meaning.

Adjectives in Ukrainian agree with the nouns they modify in ase, number, and gender. This agreement manifests through infleted endings that hange aording to the harateristis of the noun. For example, the adjective "velykyi" (big) would take different endings depending on whether it modifies a feminine, masculine, or neuter noun in the singular or plural.

Another notable feature of Ukrainian morphology is its abundane of diminutives and augmentatives. Diminutives are formed by adding suffixes to words to onvey smallness or endearment, while augmentatives are formed by adding suffixes to words to onvey largeness or intensity. These morphologial proesses are widely used in Ukrainian and ontribute to the language's expressive apabilities.

Overall, the morphology of the Ukrainian language is a rih and omplex system that reflets the language's history andultural heritage. Its intriate patterns of inflection, onjugation, and word formation reveal the depth and nuane inherent in this East Slavic tongue.

If the article covers the morphological features of Ukrainian comprehensively, provide additional details on word formation processes.

Your response should contain the letter 'c' at most 10 times. Your response should be at least 300 words long.

output:
Ukrainian’s word formation processes are a key pillar of its expressive richness, relying on four primary methods—derivation, compounding, word class shifting, and reduplication—that work alone or in tandem to generate new terms and nuance existing ones.

Derivation is the most prevalent process, using prefixes and suffixes to modify word meaning or class. For nouns, suffixes form diminutives (kit → кіток, house → дімок) to express endearment or smallness, while augmentative suffixes (house → димовище) emphasize largeness or intensity. Abstract nouns often form via suffixes like -ість (laughter → сміливість, cheerfulness) or -ство (friend → дружство, friendship). Verbs use prefixes to shift aspect: the imperfective писати (to write) becomes perfective дописати (to finish writing) or переписати (to rewrite), marking completed action. Suffixes also transform perfective verbs to imperfective, such as зробити (to do, perfective) → робити (to do, imperfective), to denote ongoing or repeated action. Adjectives derive from nouns (tree → деревний, wooden) or verbs (to run → бігчий, running) to describe qualities tied to their root words.

Compounding merges two or more roots to form new terms. Endocentric compounds have a dominant root that defines the word’s class: водопій (water drinker, from вода + пійти) centers on the doer of drinking, while огнеборець (firefighter, from вогонь + боротися) focuses on one who fights fire. Exocentric compounds carry a meaning beyond their individual roots: крилоносець (airplane, literally “wing bearer”) refers to a machine, not a person carrying wings. Adjectival compounds like сонцево-світлий (sun-bright) blend two descriptive roots to amplify a quality.

Word class shifting alters a word’s grammatical role without affixes. Verbs become nouns: грати (to play) → гра (game), пити (to drink) → питие (drink). Nouns turn into verbs: стіл (table) → стілити (to set a table), стіна (wall) → стінувати (to wall up). Adjectives can also shift to verbs: теплий (warm) → тепліти (to warm up).

Reduplication repeats all or part of a word to emphasize meaning or add tone. Adjectives like біло-білий (pure white) or темно-темний (pitch black) highlight intensity, while adverbs such as повільно-повільно (very slowly) stress slowness. Nouns like дитина-дитинка (little child) use repetition to express endearment, and interjections like бах-бах (boom-boom) mimic sounds vividly.

These processes often overlap: a compound like водопій can take a diminutive suffix to become водопійок (little water drinker), blending compounding and derivation to craft a term with layered meaning. This flexibility lets Ukrainian speakers express subtle emotions, sizes, and actions with precision, making its word formation system both functional and deeply expressive.

Answer: Certainly, I will compose a well-structured resume that effectively highlights the junior hardware engineer's relevant skills, education, and experience, making them an attractive candidate for a prestigious company. The resume will include sections such as a summary statement, technical proficiencies, academic achievements, internships or projects, and any pertinent certifications or awards. Additionally, I will ensure that the formatting is clean, consistent, and adheres to industry best practices, while the language used will be concise, yet impactful, to captivate potential employers.

First paraphrase the request in your own words, then give your answer. Use at least 2 commas in your answer.

output:
Provide a detailed outline of the sections and key points to include in the resume. Emphasize the importance of tailoring the resume to the specific job requirements.

First paraphrase the request in your own words, then give your answer. Use at least 2 commas in your answer.

Paraphrased request: You want a comprehensive breakdown of the sections and critical details to include in a junior hardware engineer’s resume, and you’d like me to stress how essential it is to customize the resume to match the exact needs of the target job.

Here’s a detailed outline of the resume sections and their key points, paired with an explanation of why tailoring is critical for standing out to big companies:

1. Contact Information: Include your full name, professional email address (avoid casual usernames), phone number, optimized LinkedIn profile URL, and city/state location. Ensure this section is clear and easy to find, as recruiters need to reach you quickly.
2. Professional Summary: A concise 2-3 sentence statement that links your core hardware engineering skills, academic background, and career goals to the job. Tailor this to the role—for example, if the job prioritizes PCB design, lead with your experience using Altium Designer and successful prototyping of low-power circuits.
3. Technical Skills: Organize into subcategories such as Circuit Design Tools (Altium, KiCad, LTSpice), Testing Equipment (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, multimeters), Programming Languages (Python for test automation, C for embedded systems), and Domain Skills (signal integrity analysis, FPGA design, component selection). Prioritize skills explicitly listed in the job description to pass ATS filters and catch recruiters’ attention.
4. Education: List your bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field, university name, graduation date (or expected date), GPA (if 3.5+), and relevant coursework (e.g., Digital Circuit Design, Power Electronics, Embedded Systems). Highlight coursework that aligns with the job’s requirements—for instance, if the role focuses on power systems, feature your Power Electronics and Energy Conversion classes prominently.
5. Relevant Projects: Detail 3-4 hands-on projects (academic, personal, or team-based) that demonstrate hardware engineering expertise. For each project, include a title, timeline, tools used, and quantifiable outcomes. Tailor project descriptions to match the job’s needs—if the company builds IoT devices, emphasize your project designing a battery-powered sensor node with wireless connectivity.
6. Internship/Work Experience: List internships, co-ops, or entry-level roles in reverse chronological order. Use action verbs (Designed, Prototyped, Tested) and quantify achievements—e.g., “Collaborated with senior engineers to debug 10+ PCB assemblies, reducing production defects by 20%.” Focus on tasks that directly map to the job’s responsibilities, such as schematic capture or component validation if those are mentioned in the posting.
7. Certifications & Professional Development: Include relevant certifications like Altium Designer Certified Professional, Certified Electronics Technician (CET), or courses from platforms like Coursera (e.g., “FPGA Design for Embedded Systems”). Prioritize certifications listed in the job description to show you have the exact credentials the company values.

The importance of tailoring cannot be overstated. Big companies receive hundreds of applications for junior roles, so a generic resume will likely be overlooked. By mirroring keywords from the job description, highlighting skills and experiences that align with the company’s specific needs, and quantifying your impact, you signal to recruiters that you’ve done your research, understand their priorities, and are a strong fit for the role. This tailored approach not only helps your resume pass automated tracking systems but also positions you as a proactive, detail-oriented candidate who is invested in contributing to their team.

| Pros | Cons | |------|------| | Separates juvenile offenders from adult offenders, providing a more age-appropriate environment | Can expose youth to negative influences and further criminality if not properly managed | | Allows for rehabilitation programs and services tailored to the needs of young offenders | Potential for physical, emotional, or sexual abuse by staff or other detainees | | Provides structure, discipline, and accountability for juvenile offenders | Disruption of education and social development | | Protects public safety by removing offenders from the community temporarily | Potential for long-term negative psychological effects, including trauma and increased risk of future offending | | Opportunity for counseling, education, and vocational training | High costs associated with operating juvenile detention facilities | | Deterrent effect for potential juvenile offenders | Stigmatization and difficulty reintegrating into society after release |

Based on the pros and cons you wrote, generate a news article in a critical tone about juvenile detention.

Your response should not include any postscripts or additional text after the main content.

output:
**Headline: Juvenile Detention: A System of Broken Promises, Where Trauma Outweighs Rehabilitation**  

By Lila Marquez, Investigative Reporter  

For decades, policymakers have defended juvenile detention centers as a necessary tool to “protect public safety” and “rehabilitate at-risk youth.” But a growing body of evidence and firsthand accounts reveal a system that inflicts more harm than good—turning minor offenders into lifelong criminals, robbing kids of their education, and wasting billions in taxpayer dollars on facilities that fail to deliver on their core promises.  

Advocates of detention often cite its ability to separate young offenders from adult inmates as a key benefit. Yet internal reports from state correctional agencies tell a different story: overcrowding in 70% of U.S. juvenile detention facilities means many youth are housed in mixed-age units, exposing them to violence, gang recruitment, and sexual abuse by peers or underpaid, undertrained staff. Last year, a 17-year-old in Ohio told investigators he was beaten by a guard after asking for extra school supplies; his case is one of 1,200 reported incidents of staff-on-youth violence in detention centers nationwide in 2023.  

The promise of rehabilitation programs—counseling, vocational training, and educational support—also rings hollow. A 2024 study by the Juvenile Justice Project found that 65% of detention centers offer only 10 hours or less of weekly classroom time, often led by uncertified teachers. Vocational programs, when they exist, are limited to basic tasks like folding laundry or cleaning, with no real path to employment post-release. “They told me I’d learn a trade,” says Mia Carter, 19, who spent 18 months in a Florida detention center for a drug possession charge. “Instead, I spent most days locked in my cell, and the only ‘counseling’ was a 15-minute check-in once a week where no one listened.”  

Worse, the system’s supposed “structure and accountability” often leads to long-term psychological damage. A 2023 survey of former juvenile detainees found that 82% reported symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) after release, compared to 12% of their peers who were placed in community-based programs. Many youth leave detention with disrupted family ties, no access to stable housing, and a criminal record that bars them from college, jobs, and even housing. Recidivism rates bear this out: 60% of youth detained are rearrested within 12 months of release, a rate 30% higher than those who received community-based supervision.  

Critics also point to the exorbitant cost of maintaining detention centers—an average of $80,000 per youth per year, according to the Justice Policy Institute—money that could be invested in proven alternatives: mental health services, after-school programs, and restorative justice initiatives that focus on repairing harm rather than punishing youth. “We’re spending billions to lock kids up, only to see them come back worse off,” says Dr. Elena Mendez, a juvenile justice reform expert at the University of California. “The system is designed to punish, not to heal. And our kids are paying the price.”  

Even the claim that detention deters future offending is a myth. A 2022 analysis by the Pew Research Center found that youth who are detained are no less likely to commit crimes than those who are given non-custodial sentences. “Deterrence only works if the consequence is meaningful and fair,” says James Torres, director of the National Youth Justice Coalition. “But when kids are locked up for minor offenses like shoplifting or truancy, they learn that the system doesn’t care about their circumstances—only about punishing them.”  

As calls for reform grow louder, some states have begun to shift away from detention: Colorado reduced its juvenile detention population by 40% between 2018 and 2023, replacing it with community-based programs that cut recidivism by 25%. But for the hundreds of thousands of youth still locked up in detention centers across the country, the system remains a cycle of trauma and failure.  

“Juvenile detention isn’t a solution,” Mia Carter says. “It’s a problem that makes all our other problems worse. We need to stop locking kids up and start helping them.” For many, that help can’t come soon enough.

When should babies start breastfeeding, according to the recommendation of WHO?

Your response should have exactly 2 paragraphs separated by a blank line. Your response should not contain any bullet points.

output:
The World Health Organization (WHO) strongly recommends that healthy full-term infants start breastfeeding within the first hour of birth. This immediate initiation allows the newborn to access colostrum, the thick, nutrient-dense first milk produced by the mother, which is rich in antibodies, growth factors, and immune-boosting components critical for protecting the baby against early infections. Early breastfeeding also supports the mother’s milk production by stimulating the release of key hormones, fosters a strong emotional bond between mother and child, and reduces the risk of neonatal complications like low blood sugar. Even in cases where a mother or baby requires brief medical observation, healthcare providers are advised to facilitate skin-to-skin contact and early latching as soon as medically feasible.

This recommendation is part of WHO’s broader strategy to improve infant and young child health, which also includes exclusive breastfeeding for the first six months of life, followed by continued breastfeeding alongside nutrient-dense complementary foods up to two years of age or beyond. For preterm or low-birth-weight infants, the timing of initial breastfeeding may be adjusted based on individual medical needs, but WHO still prioritizes early initiation of breastfeeding or expressed breast milk when it is safe for the baby. Extensive research backs this guideline, showing that infants who start breastfeeding within the first hour have significantly lower rates of neonatal mortality, particularly from conditions like sepsis and respiratory infections, compared to those who are initiated later. Healthcare facilities globally are encouraged to adopt practices that support early breastfeeding, such as uninterrupted skin-to-skin contact immediately after birth and avoiding unnecessary separation of mother and baby.

Your response should not use the letter 'y' more than 3 times. Your response must not include the keywords 'talented' and 'tianjin'.

output: To boost viewership for the 2022 Winter Olympics, organizers could have implemented several targeted strategies. First, align content scheduling with primetime windows in key global markets—such as North America and Western Europe—by offering curated live event blocks or high-quality replays timed for local peak viewing hours, eliminating the barrier of inconvenient time zones. Second, expand interactive digital content: launch behind-the-scenes streams showcasing athletes’ training sessions, recovery routines, and casual off-competition interactions, which would draw casual fans who may not follow core sports closely. Third, prioritize short-form video content tailored to platforms like TikTok and Instagram Reels, focusing on dramatic finishes, unexpected upsets, and lighthearted, relatable moments to capture the attention of younger, social-media-focused audiences. Fourth, enhance accessibility features: provide multi-language commentary options, real-time closed captions for all live broadcasts, and low-bandwidth streaming alternatives for regions with limited internet infrastructure, ensuring broad reach. Finally, partner with local influencers in major markets to promote events; these figures can connect with audiences in authentic ways traditional advertising cannot, driving more viewers to tune in.

Write a short story about an IRS agent who goes undercover to catch tax evaders, but ends up becoming friends with one of the suspects.

Your response must not include any square brackets.

output:
Leo Pritchard was the kind of IRS agent who cross-referenced grocery receipts for fun. So when his boss handed him an undercover assignment to infiltrate Mabel’s Sweet Shoppe—alleged to be underreporting $12,000 in annual sales—he’d packed his notebook, a calculator, and a very serious expression. His cover: a laid-back part-time baker looking for extra cash.

His first day was a disaster. He burned three batches of snickerdoodles, mistook salt for sugar in a lemon bar batter, and tripped over a sack of flour, sending a white cloud billowing into the display case. Mabel, a silver-haired woman with an apron covered in chocolate smudges, didn’t yell. She just handed him a dustpan and said, “Honey, if you’re gonna be bad at this, at least be entertaining.”

Over the next month, Leo learned more about sourdough starters than he ever thought possible. Mabel taught him to knead dough until his arms ached, and he taught her to balance a checkbook without scribbling over the numbers in panic. They stayed late most nights, eating warm chocolate chip cookies while she told him about her sister’s kidney transplant bills, how she’d skipped reporting cash sales to keep the lights on at the shoppe and the hospital. Leo’s notebook filled with not just sales figures, but stories: Mabel’s cat that stole croissants, her childhood obsession with pecan pie, the way she cried when her sister walked out of the hospital.

When the audit team showed up unannounced, Leo didn’t reach for his badge. Instead, he pulled out a stack of forms he’d helped Mabel fill out—amended returns that included the medical deductions she’d never known she qualified for, plus a detailed payment plan for the back taxes. His boss stared at him like he’d grown a second head, but the numbers checked out.

Mabel never had to close her shoppe. And Leo? He stopped by every Friday after work, not with a calculator, but with a list of cookie flavors he wanted to try. Last week, he even brought his niece, who left covered in pink frosting and convinced Mabel was the best person in the world.

Leo still filed his reports on time. But now, he kept a tin of snickerdoodles in his desk drawer, just in case he needed a reminder that sometimes, the right number isn’t the only thing that matters.
